Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: bmodman
Reviews.Content: Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning/maintenance guy were helpful and cheerful. Twice this maintenance guy was cleaning and saw i had a puzzled look in the lobby area and immediately asked what I was looking for and provided help. The bartender! OMG I can't recall his name, but he was friendly and accomodating as we would come in late as he was closing and had no problem fixing us drinks/wine and bar snacks (free) to take to the room. Wine...3 euro a glass...best deal in Rome!!!!!!! room in the corner of property on first floor had nice view but noisy when traffic arrived at 7am or so... we were only there 2 nights, but next time i would request change to higher room... All in all, great experience...and in the center of town within walking distance of Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Carla L
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, great breakfasts, friendly and helpful staff, was so nice having an option to watch english TV even if it was payview, better than none.

Reviews.Title: “Good lokation”
Reviews.Author: Anders H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast,but lots of noice outside the room in the morning. Near to many restaurants and most of the famous places.

Reviews.Title: “Things can only get better (and did)”
Reviews.Author: David1000
Reviews.Content: A nightmare start to this five night stay as the Jet2 plane was delayed five hours till after midnight and the hotel had rebooked the room - they said due to an electrical fault making other rooms unusable. They hadnt made any other arrangements for us, I guess they hoped we were no-shows. Whatever, they finally found us a room at the President which is also Best Western but nowhere near as highly rated as the Universo. Helpful staff but things in the President dont seem to work too well. In the morning we transferred back to the Universo to a room which I cannot fault. Good space, stylish furniture, excellent bathroom, clean and well maintained. There wasnt any coffee facility in the room but it arrive instantly when requested. The staff at the Universo are also helpful although I would avoid heading down for breakfast much after ten if you want to avoid ferocious looks. The breakfast is entirely self-service, even the coffee, and is good for continental, but not quite as good as others have suggested. The hotel location is outstandingly convenient, really close to Termini and the streets are well lit and appear safe at night. You can get the metro or buses from Termini, the 40 is a great bus across the city and very frequent, and if you get on at Termini you can get a seat (not much chance anywhere else). The hotel is very high occupancy with plenty of Far Eastern tour parties in - like most of Rome hotels I guess. We had no problem with noise whatsoever. We didnt eat in the restaurant as we like to try non-hotel food. The Tavinoletta is probably the best of the ones within a block. We also would rate the Fontana de Venere in town (near Trevi). The hotel staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. We had done most of our bookings for Vatican, Colosseum online to avoid queues - the Colosseum prebooking saves MASSES of time (so does a Roma pass when you get there) - the Vatican less so. The only other tip I would pass on is that the Opera is just round the corner and would make a special and special night out but you have to book in advance - it was sold out when we tried to book in person.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, clean and amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ElSteveLumo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our Euro Trip, we had a great experience. When we saw our surroundings we were a bit hesitant on the hotel however we have nothing but excellent reviews. Rooms are spotless very modern and accommodating, the breakfast - full buffet breakfast exceeded our expectations and we thoroughly enjoyed every morning! The front desk and concierge try to assist with bags as much as they can however the lobby is not the grandest of sizes and there is much going on. Internet was available on one computer in the lobby to which you had to put your name on a list or wait to use it. If your all keen for walking to get to where you need to go this hotel is pretty central, there are a few restaurants around. Overall, a pleasant stay- room was amazing. And when is Rome - eat plenty gelato!

Reviews.Title: “Catholman”
Reviews.Author: Catholman
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a very pleasant stay here last week. I have been to Roma many times but this was my sister's first time and my first (and definitely not last ) time at The Universo. We arrived late at night and were greeted by a very friendly receptionist ( Anna Maria ). When the porter brought us to our room it had a double bed and we had requested a twin room so the porter told us to wait while he went back to have a word at reception, when he returned he told us that we were being upgraded to a Junior Suite......and WOW what a suite it was.....absolutely excellent....a lounge area with an upstairs bedroom AND a balcony :) All the times I've been to Roma, I've never had a balcony. It was just superb. I can totally recommend The Universo Hotel.....the location is great.....the breakfast was very good.....the staff were very pleasant.....again a very special "Grazie" to Anna Maria......who is the most friendly receptionist I have ever met in Roma. All in all everything was top class. :)

Reviews.Title: “No Worries”
Reviews.Author: travellingsunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 15th through March 23rd, 2012. The hotel was ready for us promptly at check-in time. We'd booked six months in advance and requested a room with a balcony, and that is precisely what we were checked in to. I was worried about the condition of the hotel after reading some of the earlier reviews, but my worries were groundless. The room itself (room 723) was small, as other posters have indicated. It was a square about 18x18 feet with a small, attached bathroom. There was no "in-room" safe, but there were instructions that we could ask for a laptop safety box from the front desk. We did not get one, but experienced no issues leaving our laptop and other electronic devices out in plain site during the day. The hotel seems to be going for a contemporary feel, so there were no drawers at all in the room. Our nightstands were a glass shelf on either side of the bed. The desk was another glass shelf on the other side of the room. There was one armoire-styled closet with shelves. From other poster's pictures, I expected a bidet, but it's actually a low sink alongside of the toilet. The showers did not leak as I'd read previously. However, the showerhead points towards the glass door, so your choice is either to close the door behind you before turning on the shower (and thus enduring the initial blast of cold water for two seconds) or lean in and turn it on first, which gets the floor wet. LOL! Something I really liked about the bathroom was the towel warmers - a metal rack on the wall attached to the hot water pipes, which housekeeping hangs your clean towels on. That was a nice touch. Breakfast everyday consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, small sausages, a range of fresh fruits (peaches, kiwi, prunes, etc.) croissants, cereals. I enjoyed it, although if you're going to stay here for any length of time, you'll eventually get tired of it. I was full everyday. We would usually go down for breakfast around 7:30 or 8 in the morning and all was wonderful. One day we woke up early because of a reservation we had and went down at 6:30. The hot foods (eggs, meats, etc.) were not yet out. But, the coffee, fruits, and breads were available. I got the impression that it was normal to not put the hot foods out until about 7 am. The hotel is within easy, easy walking distance to Termini. Walk one street to the right, then two streets to the left and you're there. Yes, you CAN walk to the historic sites, and we DID, but it was a serious hike. We purchased a week-long metro pass, and took the subway to and from everywhere. The metro shows up every 2 minutes, and it saved us a TON of energy for walking around the sites. It was very fast and convenient. Riding the subway allowed us to really feel like Romans and less like a tourist. Overall, I would say the hotel gave us a good value for our money. We got the early-bird online special, so the price was right. The location was good (north-west side of Termini) and we never felt uncomfortable, even when returning to the hotel late at night - 10 pm or so. If you're staying in Rome for any length of time, I would recommend the location, but I would probably prefer to stay in a less "contemporary" styled hotel. Also, if you're only in Rome for a couple of days, you may want to stay closer to the historic sites as opposed to walking or riding the subway. Again, it didn't take a lot of time, and I really enjoyed it - but if you have LIMITED time, you'll want to stay closer to the historic center.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: liranmalka
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 3 day's stay at the universo hotel, we found it to be good value for money,breakfast was only nice- no vegetables.

Reviews.Title: “would definately return”
Reviews.Author: Margaret M
Reviews.Content: having just returned from a weeks stay at the universo hotel,i found it to be good value for money,on our arrival we did not have the room we booked and were disappointed,when we brought this to the hotels attention our room was changed the next day which we were more than happy with,breakfast was also very good with lots to choose from,don't understand the negative comments regarding breakfast on some reviews.i would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jasonalison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel and were a bit worried then when we read some reviews!!!! I am quite a fussy person so if I'm staying away from home I like it to be 2 things - reasonably priced and clean!!!! Arriving at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised - reception area and staff very welcoming - we were on the 7th floor and our room was very clean and comfortable - king size bed - tv - mini bar - desk - wardrobe - beautiful bathroom with bath and overhead shower - we had no problem accessing the free wifi either! Breakfast in the morning was ok - but that's not the hotels fault - I like my own cereal etc so that's not a criticism to the hotel - fresh fruit - which I did enjoy - along with various breads - cold meats - hot foods etc were all available at all times. Location wise - we were only a few minutes walk from the Termini and maybe 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain which was a perfect distance - close enough but far enough if you know what I mean!!! Rome itself is very expensive but my stay at this hotel was not and would have no hesitation in booking this again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Patersoneditha
Reviews.Content: Best Western Universo was recommended by our travel agent. When I first arrived in front of the hotel, the street was a bit narrow and the facade was unimpressive. I felt bad that I did not fully check with tripadvisor on this hotel. Upon entering, however, the receptionist were quite helpful. While the hotel looks old, it had undergone good renovation and upgrade. The rooms were OK and its restaurant and dining hall were very satisfactory. From the outside, the hotel was not impressive but, pleasant surprise in the inside, its service and facilities as quite good for me. The staff is very helpful. I liked their breakfast serving. I enjoyed my stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Carlos2610
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip through easyjet holidays as a package and firstly I should say how good the whole service was, easy to use & good value. I'll definitely use them again. This hotel was perfect for our 3 night stay. We arrived to a easy check in procedure from very helpful and polite staff. We then made out way to the rooms, we found the rooms pretty small but very clean and modern. The bathroom was finished really well and also nice and clean. The position of the hotel was excellent, we walked a lot of the time but getting home by taxi sometimes never cost more than €8 in a taxi from the Vatican, colosseum, etc. The Trevi fountain, Spanish steps & Pantheon were all within 10 minutes walking distance. Breakfast was more than adequate, a good selection and plenty of it. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to friends & family. There was 4 of us on the trip (my parents, my wife & I) and we all were impressed by the hotel. Rome itself is very very expensive so be prepared. Spending €1000 euros in a few days was far too easy with their inflated costs. But Rome is a place you have to see in your lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: msb444
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. The rooms are small though but very clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom is modern. The room has central heating and it became very warm in the night. I prefer a cooler room when I sleep, even in the winter. When I asked housekeeping how I could control the room temp, I was told that the the hotel had central heating and so the aircondition in the room was off. I was then told to to open the window a little. Problem is, it is a busy street and can get very noisy. Breakfast was okay. I liked the orange juice, coffee and breads, The bacon though was too salty. The hotel caters to a lot of tourists groups so it can get crowded.

Reviews.Title: “For location and price, it can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Donna09
Reviews.Content: This hotel was moderately priced for a week in Rome and was within walking distance of everything. The Termini Train Station was 2 minutes, the Vatican 20 minutes, the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon 15 minutes. The rooms are small (by American standards), but well eqipped. The breakfast buffet is good, with scrambled eggs every morning. Also a nice assortment of pasteries and breads. At least 2 or 3 kinds of fruit, and a chocolate fondue fountain. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant one of the nights and the veal escalope in citrus was very good, as was the lemon cake for desert. Hotel staff was friendly. Only downside was the need to request a new wifi access code each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loizos V
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is amazing since its 2 mins walk from the main train station that will take u to airport in 25 mins. 10 mins away from downtown (walking) and around 15-20 from Coloseum !! Central location, with lots of hotels around Friendly staff, and really AMAZING breakfast. The restaurant is not the best you can get. Really nice rooms :)

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel catering to groups”
Reviews.Author: 16Carolyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, and felt secure and comfortable. This is a fairly impersonal hotel, where the staff did not speak unless spoken to, although they were helpful when requests were made. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Our room was a loft, with the king bed up the stairs from the sitting area and bathroom. Several good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: nikkid1009
Reviews.Content: ...so easy to get to from Termini! Breakfast was decent. We were in a room with 2 singles- I would suggest requesting a room with a street view as our window opened up to the building backs and piping. The hotel was very clean and when our showerhead broke, the front desk had it fixed by the time we returned from dinner. That quick response was much appreciated! :-) We walked across the street to another hotel (Torino?) as it had a rooftop patio where we could watch the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “New Year Holiday”
Reviews.Author: radu_cataniciu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated in Rome, very close to Termini Station and around 1 km to Colosseum, Imperial Forum and Campidoglio. Is easy to reach by foot from hotel to those places. The staff was very helpfull and the room ( especially no.741) was very nice decorated and the bathroom was beautiful. We spend the New Year Eve party in this hotel. The party was a succes becase of the BAND (called "H" ) who was very professional and played all the night till 2 am. Minus in this party: the menuwasn't so good and the head of the restaurant closed the party contrary of the wishes of the guests. Radu and Cristina Cataniciu

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect/quase perfeito”
Reviews.Author: Vivian0605
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a good location, next to Termini Station, but not too close. It´s clean, the room and bathroom are realy big. Wi-fi is free, but it´s a little annoying because you have to change password every single day. Would only complain about breakfast: it´s very good if you wake up after 8:00am, but before 8:00 there´s no fruits, no chocolate, no eggs. I would expect that a 4 star hotel to be able to offer a complete breakfast at 6:30 am, as promised. O hotel tem uma boa localização, próximo ao Termini, mas não próximo demais (estações de trem são iguais em todos os países). É limpo, os quartos e os banheiros são grandes. Tem internet gratuita, mas incomoda ter que mudar o password todos os dias. Reclamo apenas do café da manhã: é ótimo após 8:00h, mas antes não há frutas, chocolate, ovos. Esperaria que um hotel 4 estrelas conseguisse fornecer o café da manhã completo às 6:30h, como é anunciado. Isso aconteceu todos os 4 dias que fiquei hospedada, e sempre foram "pontualmente atrasados" nesse aspecto.

Reviews.Title: “Last nights in Europe”
Reviews.Author: SteveTravler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel and purchased it as a WOTIF bargain. It was above the standard we had used for the previous 9 weeks, so a luxurious refreshing end to to our Grand European Tour. Check-in however started on a sour note as we arrived on the train from Orvieto at 1PM and had dragged our bags the 500 Meters from Termini to be told we could not check in til 2PM (60Minutes). So we sat and waited. I expected to be told when the room was ready as we sat directly in front of the counter watching the staff. I approached reception at 5 mins past 2 and the room was ready (why had they not let me know?). The room was luxurious by our 3 star standard and the breakfast buffet was very good (a bit slow replenishing eggs and bacon), but a good selection. Bonuses:- We had one of the few rooms with opening windows over VIA Principe Amedeo and a six inch wide balcony. Good for people watching and Apero. A few complaints :- - The air-con in the room would not cool it down below 25 degrees so I turned it off and opened the window - however every time we came back it was back up to 25 degrees. - They have free WiFI but you have to go down to reception every day and ask for a new ticket. - Lots of tourist buses use this hotel so you may have neighbors leaving at early hours. - Nearly all the tables at breakfast are set for 8 or 10 Overall - a good hotel in a good location - near to Via Cavour, Termini and Republica but I would not pay full price. If you are at all scientific, DO NOT MISS Santa Maria degli Angeli e dei Martiri which is a church Michaelangelo designed inside some old ruined Roman baths at Republica and is a shrine to Galileo. Outstanding hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Megan K
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying 2 nights here. Overall the hotel was pleasant, well decorated, and clean. The location was very convenient to the Termni, however we felt that it was in a touristy part of town. It should be noted, and I am not sure why no one else has posted it, but it is an AFFILIATE of Best Western (meaning, that it carries the Best Western sign and trademark but it is owned by a private owner (possibly of another local hotel operator, there are R's for the brand name), however it is not the typical Best Western that we as American's are used too). There are bellmen and it is a bit more ritzy. I only rated it average because: If you are expecting a soft bed, this place is not for you. Our mattress was rock-hard! we also had a rock hard mattress at a different local hotel in Paris so we are not sure if this is the standard for Europe. My husband and I are used to a somewhat softer mattress (we have a pillowtop at home). The other BW that we have stayed at in the U.S. have softer mattresses. Also we arrived around 12:30-1:00 pm, when we got there the lady at the front desk said that our room would not be ready until 2:00 pm, however my husband was hinting to them that he really would like to take a shower after traveling all day so finally they said we could check in at 1:30, after reading some reviews some were let in earlier than others, our theory was that we had 1 large piece of luggage with 2 carry-on rollers and we felt they just wanted to use it as an excuse so that they bellman could carry our luggage up later when the room was "ready" so that we would be forced to pay him a tip. The free continental breakfast is horrible (possibly that is why it is free, there is no way we would ever pay for the food). The reason why I say it is not good is the eggs and cold meat slices are really salty, the croissants were rock hard, and the orange juice was not tasty. When you first initially see the buffet as you walk in it appears there is alot of food, however after you start tasting it, you realize that there is not a lot of "good" food to eat. On the second day we ate breakfast (unfortunately we were leaving and were short on time that is why we were forced to either eat the free continental breakfast or no breakfast so we had some cereal (yes the cereal was somewhat decent) we were the first ones there and there were 20-30 gnats/ small fruit flies in and around the orange juice machine, got a glass and it had about 5 dead gnats floating, which tells me either the machine was not cleaned the day prior or it was not cleaned/inspected that very morning before the buffet opened. There is one good item and that is the chocolate fountain with fresh fruit, it was delicious. It is a good, clean hotel that is very continent to the Termini and Colosseum. If we ever do decide to return to Rome, we won't be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel Universo”
Reviews.Author: Gordon B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just back from Rome where we spent 2 nights (Dec 3rd, 4th) in the Universo. I can recommend this hotel very highly. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived at noon and our room was ready for us. Room 218 which was really comfortable and relaxing. A little stairway led up to our very comfortable bedroom. The bathroom was excellent which had a most refreshing shower. An excellent breakfast served in wonderful surroundings. Special mention to the barman who served fantastic drinks with a smile.. The location is excellent, close to all the major attractions of this wonderful city.Will be back in Rome next year and can't wait to return to this beautiful hotel again . Gordon and Muriel Butler...Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Excelent !”
Reviews.Author: Caproni
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, well located near Termini Station, little walk from Sta Maria Maggiore Church and Coliseum . Hotel staff was very nice, giving some maps and advises for Rome attractions. Hotel room is very confortable and quiet, good bed, very nice bathroom. Hotel breakfast is very nice (lots of Nutella, fruits and juices). Wifi is free, just ask the staff. I will stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...yet again!”
Reviews.Author: Chanelle83
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this fantastic hotel! I stayed here for 3 nights last year and loved it so much that this year I was determined to stay here again prior to the long 22 hour flight back to Australia. I was given a comfortable room with a fantastic large shower (the best of the showers I've had in Europe) and firm yet comfortable bed. This hotel is in a fantastic location with an easy 5 minute walk to Roma Termini station and a couple of great restaurants nearby. There's a laundromat an easy 5 minute walk on the same street. Plenty of internet cafes are nearby. Reception staff were extremely helpful and happy to accomodate if you have any concerns. Buffet breakfast with plenty of variety. You are definitely getting value for money. Housekeeping are smart and don't disturb you if you have the sign on the door! I have stayed at a rather basic hotel in Rome prior to an Intrepid tour and had housekeeping knock once and enter while I had just stepped out of the shower...you won't be experiencing that at this hotel. I could not fault my stay here at the end of a massive 3 month trip. Loved it...yet again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: clairess_11
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for sightseeing- a fairly easy walk to all the main sights. The room was good, just a little odd to have a room with a mezzanine as you have to walk downstairs to go to the bathroom in the night. Breakfast was okay but nothing too special. Reception staff were not friendly, but we had no troubles and they helped us with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Terrible attitude. Strange rooms”
Reviews.Author: bhxteacher
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel last week. Overall, the hotel was OK, but we had a few problems. First, the front desk refused to give us 2 key cards to our room. They said it was a security issue. This caused us some problems in coordinating our coming and going separately. Understand that the key card must be inserted into a slot inside the room to activate the electricity and air conditioner. If my wife wanted to take a nap (with the air on), she needed to keep the card in the room. This precluded me from going out and returning without waking her to let me in. The second problem was with the configuration of the first room they placed us in. It was a 2 level set-up with the bed and TV on the upper level and the bathroom on the lower lever. Being among the "older" crowd, we need to use the bathroom during the night. This means walking down the somewhat narrow stairs while partially asleep. 2 other couples in our group also were given these "superior" rooms and had the same complaints. One of them also said that the lower level had no furniture. We were able to change to a more standard room the second night. I must say though, that the rooms were very clean and the hotel overall was very spiffy. The free breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped room!”
Reviews.Author: Mac097
Reviews.Content: Very close to station, and a good location for bus & train travel to all destinations. Old style hotel, with old fashioned lobby and common areas. Rooms have been updated recently, to a high standard, but are very small. Hardly room to move between chairs and bed. Bathroom well apointed, but also very small. Breakfast room was very crowded, and not conducive to a relaxing breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Brendanwex
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with my girlfriend for a short break in Rome. While the room was quite small (as expected in a European city) it was nicely decorated with a beautiful bathroom. The balcony overlooking the side street was a nice addition. Buffet breakfast was nice as was the morning coffee. Staff were also very friendly and efficient. Also just to add it is very close to the main bus / tram terminal as well as the metro line.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ozeabroad
Reviews.Content: We were unfortunate enough to be booked into this Hotel for 5 nights (5 nights too long!!!) by our 'trusted' travel agent, in June this year. On arrival at 1.30pm we were told by the most gruff, impolite, unhelpful and unhappy front desk staff that our room was not yet ready. No problem; we checked our bags in and headed off to lunch. An hour and a half later we returned to the hotel to be told that our room was still not ready, could we wait another45 minutes. We went for a wander and returned in an hour, only to be told that we would have to wait another 45 minutes. On enquiring as to what the hold up for checking in was, I was met with a curt, sarcastic and unnecessarily rude reply- not a good start! The next morning ,the restaurant staff was extremely unorganized and the buffet was not replenished anywhere near often enough. We had to pay for our breakfast in our package, but 3 mornings we had to leave the Hotel and go elsewhere for breakfast as we could not find seating at the hotel restaurant. Thank goodness Rome has a lot to offer as far as sightseeing goes. It enabled us to not have to spend too much time at this hotel. We travelled through Malta, Spain, Sicily, and Italy for many months and the only hotel that we stayed at that we ALL disliked was The Universo. The staff at this hotel seem miserable. They are neither welcoming nor accomodating. We often sat in the foyer and watched other guests complain to the front desk about one thing or another. It was embarassing to watch how unprofessional the front desk was in dealing with these guests. The ONLY thing that this hotel has going for it is it's close proximity to the Metro; but it's not nearly close enough to inspire me to stay here again. On my return home, I visited my travel agent and strongly recommended that she not suggest this hotel to future travellers!

Reviews.Title: “" Due to the mixed reviews, I didn't know what to expect"”
Reviews.Author: joanneguardino
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our three children stayed at the Universo in August for three days. Before booking I researched a lot of hotels but felt that the Universo was best suited to our needs and budget.Not all of the reviews I read for the hotel were very good so I really didn't know what to expect. All I can say is that we made a good choice! The hotel is situated five minutes from the train station. It is an excellent location. Even if you are not traveling by train the train station is home to a mini shopping centre. If you are looking for a 'proper' supermarket there is a spar outside the back of the station. The hotel itself lived up to what I expected. The rooms were nicely decorated but not massive. Our air conditioning was perfect and kept us cool. Free wi-fi is available if you have your own laptop, you have to request a daily code from reception. Ours sons had a front view and we had the view of the brick wall. I did not complain one bit as it ensured silence. I had the best nights sleep ever! The beds are also really comfy. I found all of the staff very helpful and polite. The breakfast was a standard continental with a varied choice. i don't think any continental breakfast could compare to a full english! One point that did surprise me was the cost of drinks within the hotel - very cheap in comparison to the prices around Rome. we did have a look at the gym, it was very good but there was no chance of using it in August. Way too hot for exercise! All in all a very good hotel to which we would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jw201107
Reviews.Content: The great thing about this hotel is it was so easy to walk to the train station everyday. Taking in to consideration the amount of time we spent in our room and how close it is to the station we would use this hotel again.Staff was always helpful. It is well located for seeing the usual tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: ztraveler4
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. Close to the train station and many attractions. We walked all over Rome from here. Great breakfast, clean rooms, but the staff was makes it extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with no A/C”
Reviews.Author: msk2193
Reviews.Content: Don't expect t set yur thermostat below 80 degrees. No matter what setting you use, the front desk controls the room temperature and will not set it below 26 Celsius, or 78 Fahrenheit. Disgusting sleeping temperature, and of course does not make for a good vacation. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon021_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Universo hotel in Rome during our travels through Italy in January 2011. The location is good - easy walking distance to the Roma Termini as well as the tourist bus services, central city location with easy access to tourist sites. The hotel is modern, clean, the service was good and the buffet breakfast was very good. We would stay here if in Rome again and can recommend this hotel to other travellers wanting a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mcommins
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The room was large with heaps of ambient lighting, comfortable bedding and quality linen. We arrived to Rome really early via an overnight train. The hotel staff were very helpful in offering us breakfast (at a cost of course) which we gladly accepted as Rome doesn't have many places open for breakfast in the mornings!!! After breakfast the staff got us into our room as soon as one was available which we really appreciated. Breakfast here was excellent, but when we were here a guest had her bag stolen whilst she got up to get food. This is an important lesson that you can get robbed almost anywhere in Europe (even having breakfast in a busy hotel), so as they say have your hand on your heart and elbow on your wallet at all times! Anyway, this incident wasn't the hotel's fault and I would recommend this place to anyone. The hotel also sold us a personal guide to the Vatigan. The guide's name was "Valentino" and he was excellent. He really made our trip in Rome (well worth considering)!

Reviews.Title: “We must come back again”
Reviews.Author: CairoKhalil
Reviews.Content: Me & my family stayed for 6 nights from 02 July till 08 July its clean & room is wwll furnished ,Staff very helpful specialy Mr.Johnny M. in the Reseption he guided us to many good place , Hotel is near main train & bus stations (Termini) and Subway station Very Good Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTraveler43
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen by our travel agent. We stayed here for 3 nights recently with our family, 2 standard rooms with breakfast included. The location is great, within walking distance from the train station (better if you are traveling with fewer and smaller suitcases than we had) and a short cab ride or doable walk to most sites. The hotel has a mix of pleasure and business guests. The front desk staff was brisk, efficient , competent, and friendly enough. Breakfast was typical, but did include hot items and was convenient. My only complaint is the persistent smell of sewer drain in our room and in the hallway. We dealt with this by covering the bathroom drain with the bathmat, which helped. Rooms were clean, but are basic and showing a little wear. Bathroom had a large sink, a robust hot shower with plenty of water pressure and a normal working hair dryer. There are no safes in the room, but we used the safe provided at the front desk without any problem. The hotel is a bit "industrial" and lacks charm, but that speaks more to personal taste than a problem with the hotel. The shopkeeper next door directed us to a restaurant around the corner with great pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: 1248justjoan
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Hotel Universo. It is an excellent hotel, rooms were very comfortable and clean. Staff was always helpful. It is well located for seeing the usual tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VipulG
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a business trip for 3 weeks. Staff are quite courteous and helped us on the various excursions we took and readily serviced us but the rooms were dirty. In my room, air conditioning was not working. Had to contact the staff to get it rectified. Further also, internet connectivity was through TV and was non functional. They were unable to resolve the problem and ultimately had to switch rooms. Breakfast was included in my package and that was really good with a wide variety of choices for both veg and non-veg customers. Overall, I would say its just about an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BellaTravelerNikki
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a business conference that we added onto for pleasure as well. The hotel was lovely, but the staff really made the place remarkable. So helpful and friendly, no matter what the issue - from suggested shopping, to ringing for taxi's, for solving watch battery problems, they helped with everything. The Italian people are very lovely, and the staff here really lived up to that reputation.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting hygeine practice”
Reviews.Author: docmyla
Reviews.Content: the hotel and staff were excellent- but we were appalled by the cleaning staff- the toilet -including the bathtub ,floors and the WC were cleaned in front of us -using the bath towels we had used the previous evening !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! we swore of using any hotel towels for the rest of the trip !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! talk about 4/5 star services !--- WOW ! best western- any where in the world- NEVER AGAIN !!!!!!!!!! MYLA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs, friendly and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: diane160_0
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we trust the Best Western brand, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is about 5 minutes easy walk from the main railway station, Termini, with access to the Metro, buses and trains all from the same point. The room was very comfortable,spacious and with everything we needed, except some decent English-speaking television! Despite a previous review to the contrary, I am happy to report that the corridors are indeed a normal width! The air-conditioning kept the room at a comfortable temperature and the windows kept out the noise of the streets below (although I actually love the noise of the bustle of a city, why would you stay in a city like Rome if you're looking for peace and quiet?!) The staff were friendly (with a sense of humour!) so we forgave them the accidental 6.30 alarm call on our first morning! Breakfast was good, catering for many tastes with eggs, bacon and sausages, cereal, breads, cold meats and cheeses, pastries and a chocolate fountain (!) My only complaint would be the poor Wi-Fi access, I heard other guests comment on this too, but it wasn't a deal-breaker for me as it would be for others. There was a PC in the lobby for access if needed. Just a word of warning about the wonderful pavement cafes - watch out for hidden charges, we were charged 4 euros to eat outside even though the cafe had no indoor tables, and also given bread (dry) as an appetiser which we didn't ask for and which cost 2 euros each. Many cafes and restaurants do not impose these charges, just be careful what you are paying for before you start. I can particularly recommend two restaurants in Piazza Navona, Ristorante Navona and La Bevitoria. And enjoy Roma, what a wonderful city it is!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Alekb62
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Rome where I was with my 23 years old daughter for a few days holidays like a city break. We stayed at Universo Hotel and it was great ! Good location (we walked from there to every historical location - no need to take metro), very amiably staff and very clean room. We'll be back.... Thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Double Charged”
Reviews.Author: 3000sb
Reviews.Content: I just want travellers who book a stay at the Best Western Universo Rome, to keep a close eye on your Visa bill. I booked my stay through Expedia and two weeks before my trip I noticed a charge on my Visa for the Best Western Universo in Rome. I have never travelled over seas before so I just thought the Hotel charged the room ahead of time. When I checked into the Hotel, I mentioned that I had been charged already for my stay. The Hotel said that they didn't have a record of my payment and that I would have to pay again and sort it out when I got home. I have called Expedia at least 5 times and emailed all my info , but they haven't been much help. I have put a call into Visa who has told me that this double charging happens a lot. Seems to be common practice especially if you book through and agent like Expedia. I hope Visa will be able to straighten out the mess and I can get my $600.00 back.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning, need to open the window”
Reviews.Author: dr_icecan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of April for three night. This was the first time for us to travel by ourselves. This hotel was booked as a Hotel + air ticket packet via the CX holidays. The hotel is well located which is near to the Termini station. However the road to it is very bumpy. My wife had difficulty to move her luggage. The staff are helpful. Also u can ask for free internet (WiFi) at the frontdesk. They will give u the password. XD. Also u can use the computer at the lobby for printout. The room size is better then expected. No kettle was available. As there was no air conditioning in April, we need to open the window. We were waken up in the morning by the noise from the garbage truck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: LuciDublin
Reviews.Content: About a 5 minute walk from station when you know the location. Efficient staff check in was fine. Room was normal one for this area, small but with most items. TV, fridge but no kettle for those of us who like tea. Room clean but no a/c so can get quite hot even in April. Breakfast was fine and good selection. From Termini walk along Via Cavour, at hotel Genova which is on the right turn right and Universo is on the left about 3 minute walk form Hotel Genova.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in rome”
Reviews.Author: beckany
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 nights at hotel universo earlier this month and it was a good start to our holiday. I concur with some positive and negative reports from other travelers. The front staff were very helpful, but you just needed to be patient at times. Our room was beautifully cleaned and restocked each day and there was always a friendly greeting from them. Breakfast was chaotic, particularly when a tour group was in. We ate at various times during our stay and only ever found hot items once. Cold cuts, pastries and cereals were always well stocked however. We also experienced a snell in our room, but did not feel the need to report it. We did not use the biday but when we ran water into it, the snell disappeared. The bed was ok and the pillow menu great to have, along with free wifi. We would return. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Rico_Starbucks
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very old and a bit dirty. The hallways were very narrow, only one person could fit in it. The rooms were even smaller, I bumped my head on the headboard because it was so cramped inside. The bathroom was the only decent thing. No internet. The staff will offer you all sorts of tours / airport transfers but they are expensive!! Then there were bed bugs. BIG BROWN ONES! eeeek! Breakfast time was absolutely CHA-O-TIC!! Everybody rushing to the buffet. No utensils, no glasses. They don't even clean the table and the plates. The coffee and juice were from a vendo machine. It tastes pathetic. And we even had to wait for eggs / bacon and toast because they ran out!! Eating bacon was like eating pure salt and pure oil. Absolutely chaotic! Only good thing was it was 10 mins walk from the subway central station. We just ate there because the food was terrible at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Rome = great location!”
Reviews.Author: Chanelle83
Reviews.Content: I received excellent service and appreciated the reception staff ensuring I had a pleasant stay. The hotel is in a great location, with the Roma Termini station easily accessible, and laundromats and internet cafes a brief walk from the hotel. As a backpacker, I found the hotel extremely relaxing and enjoyed my last 2 days of freedom in a clean and tidy (and luxuriously larger shower compared to those in other hotels) room before heading back to Australia. The buffet breakfast showed variety and was enjoyable. The reception staff were very helpful in assisting me to book a Hop on Hop off bus tour around Rome and were lovely to ensure my airport transfers were still booked. I have no dislikes of this hotel and will certainly be recommending it to friends who are looking to experience such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Foodiesta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a group tour. Nothing to complain about. Had to get used to having one room card and requesting free wi-fi access daily. However, it is close to the train station where you can take the train to most of the major sites. Staff was friendly and the breakfast was really good. Our room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “good busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleanconscioustravel
Reviews.Content: 5 min walk from the train station, from the hotel we walked to all the major sights all the way to the vatican then couldnt be bothered doing the walk back to got a taxi. check in is very slow process. rooms were modern but need repair. tv with english news channels. we only got one room key that needs to stay in a slot for the lights to work but can be a bit of a problem. clean but sheets could be cleaner, i hate seeing any hair on sheets. dirty marks on the walls and curtain. the worst thing was the horrible smell in the room. i think its the carpet. seriosly revolting smell. needs a good steam clean. we had a room that had a dangerous window in the bathroom, massive window that opens up with no safety screen . EXTREMELY DANGEROUS IF YOU HAVE CHILDREN. They tried to put modern touches to the rooms but they end up being annoying. like the showerhead and the odd shaped basins. we found that water just floods the shower floor when you use the shower if you are not careful. Breakfast was very well stocked but they could do with cleaning the cutlery storage as it has lots of crumbs on the bottom. A general good clean of all the breakfast area would be a good idea. i hate seeing crumbs everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Swissmex
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently. I was very pleased with the serviced offered, there is free wifi, which is always fantastic. The breakfast was excellent as well. Lots of things to chose from. The personnel is always ready to help. It's around the block from Termini station, so upon arrival from the airport you just walk there, and there are two metro stations right there. Sometimes the reception gets very busy and you have to wait in line, but well.. Something else I would change (but probably in the whole of Italy) is that I would upgrade to duvets. Bedsheets and bedspreads are disgusting. The rooms could be better sound isolated as well. You hear people talking on the hallways. Highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: YMLUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. The room was fantastic, we would have moved in if you could. Breakfast was average. The location was really good - we could walk to Santa Maria in 5-10 minutes and Colusseum in 20 min. Easy walk from Termini. Also there is a scooter/bicycle hire place 2 minutes away (Baci Baci). The Reception staff, I have to admit, were neither helpful nor friendly. An excellent pizzaria nearby, La Gallina Bianca, is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Near the train station, but a little far from the sights.”
Reviews.Author: LivingtheGoodLife3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the BW Universo. I travelled with my 8 year old son. The walk to the hotel from the train station was very easy and only about 8 minutes. Because my husband was not allowed to come with us at the last minute we were able to get a smaller and less expensive room. The room was very clean and pretty modern. We liked their shampoo and soap! There was a lot of street noise even from the 4th floor. It seemed like there were a lot of delivery trucks on our street all through the night. The breakfast was very good and plentiful with lots of variety. All in all we liked the hotel but we kept finding ourselves walking quite a ways to get to the sights. Maybe 20 minutes to the Colleseum, 20 minutes to Via del Corso. We had good weather and we like to walk, but it would've been nicer to be closer!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel! If ever in Rome will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: T0tal_Tan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 221 for two nights and had very pleasant experience. The bedroom with very high ceiling, which allowed to design two level studio with sleeping area upstairs. The bed was enormous and very comfortable with memory foam mattress cover, which made sleep quality up to the highest standard.Large balcony with street view and huge arch shaped window. Perfect bathroom, but no bath tube only shower. Mini bar comes very handy and not expensive. TV with music and movies on demand at extra. Very good breakfast with large variety to suite all tastes. Lobby and all other areas of hotel clean and well kept. It is a beautiful hotel with very central location, which made our Rome citybreak enjoyable and unforgettable. I will be hopefully visiting Rome again in few years for a longer break and in summer time as I loved the city and will stay at Universo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gogo65
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for work and was hesitant about the location. Everything I read seemed to say that this area of Rome was not nice, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was fantastic, the rooms were amazing, very modern, huge bathrooms, we had a bath with shower as well as a huge walk in shower. I am not sure if all bathrooms are like this though. The breakfast had a good selection. When we arrived the check in staff were very helpful and friendly, they organised airport transfers for 45euro, the car arrived early and was a lovely mercedes. (we had taken the train from the airport on our arrival, at 14 euro each) so the transfer was excellent value. We felt that we were quite central to everything Rome had to offer, a nice 10-15 minute walk to either the colosseum or the trevi fountain, or a quick walk to the metro. We felt safe at all times (2 single females) I am going back to Rome next year and will book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - No complaints whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: SDGKolkata
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel a lot. The location is good as it's 5-10 minutes walk from the station. The reception was fantastic as they enquired about out planned trip and dropped in suggestions to help us. Suggestions and services that the hotel provided was very good, helpful and hassle free. The rooms were two storied, with the bedroom at the second tier, assecible by a flight of stairs. The bathrooms were very clean, modern and elegant. They have a bell boy who helps with the luggage. Restaurant was good. The staff was the best we encountered in all the hotel we visited in Europe - maybe only surpassed by one in England, but no doubt great staff.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the service!”
Reviews.Author: Sam_0102Singapore
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel end July and had my bag stolen right in my hotel room. I am only writing a review now as I am getting frustrated over the service that has been given to me since that unpleasant incident and to warn other travellers about it. To be fair to the hotel, in terms of location, rooms and value they are competitive to other hotels I have stayed in. However, in terms of service, they really do have a long way to go. I had my new bag (which cost quite a bit!) stolen in my hotel room which was locked while we were out for dinner. I was told to make a police report and claim insurance from the hotel which I did accordingly. However, I find myself till today still trying to claim my insurance. The hotel relinquished their responsibilities by saying the insurance company will contact me instead. It has been more than 2 months and I have yet to hear from either party. Rome is a beautiful place with good food and awesome sights. It was just a pity that this theft ruined the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel (not Very Good) - great location - 20 mins from everywhere in Room”
Reviews.Author: RobertsMom
Reviews.Content: If I could I would rate this a 3.5 Good - but TripAdvisor options don't have a Good... they go from Average to Very Good. The purpose of our trip was a business conference. The conference/meetings were held at the hotel. We had a double room. Number 233. We did follow a Trip Advisor's advice and contacted the hotel and booked a car to take us from the airport to the hotel. After a long flight from the states, we didn't want to bus it to the Termini Terminal and drag our bags - but we did see plenty of folks doing it. We would book the car again. The ride from FCO airport is about 30 mins to the hotel Our hotel room was clean and of average size for European hotel rooms. Very little closet/stoarge space. No dresser drawers, but the closet/storage unit was roomy enough for both my husband and my clothes. The bathroom was roomy. The room was clean. There was a glass-door to the outside but the view was to the interior of the building wings and just looked out on the a/c unit. The air conditioning was not really working well - we would've preferred it to be a bit cooler, so I was glad we were there in late Sept. There is high-speed internet in the rooms and I think it was free. There is wifi in the lobby area, but they need to give you an access code and its good for 1 hour daily. I didn't bother to get more than 1 a day so I don't know if thats an option. The hotel has a restaurant, but I never saw it opened for dinner - only for breakfast, which had a good variety of breakfast items; cereals, fruits, juices, eggs, meats, breads, coffees etc. There is a small fitness center. I did use it and the machines worked well. The hotel is about 1/2 a block from the Opera House and about 5 mins to Termini Terminal and about 5 mins to Via Nacional - which is a great main street. Only once did we venture over to Termini Terminal and we felt a bit uncomfortable with some of the people hanging around there - they were clearly not "travelers". Other than that we felt very comfortable in the streets of Rome and we walked everywhere. The only time we needed to take a taxi was to go to the Vatican museums because it was on the other side of town and we knew it would be a long day. I guess you could walk there. There are lots of restaurants/cafe & food shops within an easy walk. I would recommend the rooftop restaurant at the Hotel Bernini Bristol. It's right by Triton Fountain. It's pricy, but the food was excellent and the view from the restaurant is beautiful. We ate there twice and on our 2nd time dining there, there was a small wedding party celebrating up on the terrace with us. The restaurant terrace is covered so even lunch would be very nice. AND seems to me that the indoor restaurants/terrace are non-smoking - I don't know about the sidewalk cafes. But we didn't see any smoking indoors or even saw ashtrays. From the hotel we walked to: The Pantheon, the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Triton Fountain, Santa Maria de la Concezione (look it up - its not to be missed), Palazzo Barberini and Hard Rock Cafe on Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again”
Reviews.Author: licahil
Reviews.Content: Good location if you plan to stay close to Termini rail station is a few minutes walk. Hotel itself not really impressive the rooms are very small with no drawers and a tiny bathroom with a shower only. Does have air conditioning which is about the only good part .Buffet Breakfast was good but overall I wouldn’t stay again at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff- Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: phxaztraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Very easy to find from the main train station. When exiting the station exit on the left side of the station, proceed across the street, and head to Principe Amado. Approximately 10 minute walk to hotel. Check in is 2pm. We arrived at 11am and had to wait but staff was very accomodating and recommended a great lunch location just around the corner (The White Hen). The hotel checked our bags for us. We returned at 2pm and were promptly checked in. Anna was great at the front desk. The rooms were very clean, very comfortable, good internet...a bit slow.. but not bad. Easy walking distance to many great restaurants (El Gran Cafe, La Famiglia). Would definately stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic Service”
Reviews.Author: sria2000
Reviews.Content: Just cant think of one good thing abt this hotel 1. When we first walked in the hotel, none of the staffs in the reception were courteous. We were greeted as if we were aliens. 2. Rooms are very small and bathrooms are even smaller. 3. Breakfast was crap. Out of 3 days we stayed, toaster was broken for two days & hence no bread available. Fruits were all old stock . Though the bfast opened at 6:30am, most of the stuffs were not aval until 7:30. No one was greeted at the bfast table , no special treatment for kids.. In total not worth the money we spend..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Qreall
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel which is located near the Termini Station. That gives him a big plus because it allows to be mobile and use the metro and train for movement. The historic center is also in walking distance. Friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms, full breakfast is left of it a positive experience. The only downside was not easy, and terribly slow elevator. And since we were highly are more upset because he had to wait an average of 5 minutes. But this small disadvantage smoothed overall comfort, so we just forgot about it.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: andy998
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Universo for two nights - Aug 15th and 16th. We had booked a while back so had been concerned about recent Trip Advisor reviews - we needn't have worried. Our room was modern, well equipped, very clean and very comfortable. The staff were without exception courteous, helpful and efficient. The restaurant was good - a wide range of food at breakfast to suit all tastes; we also ate in the restaurant for dinner and very much enjoyed our meals - prices were very competitive. The bar was good value too. Was ideally located for Roma Termini station and also well placed for sightseeing. We would certainly consider staying here if we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Very Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Cameron1973
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and will also be our last. When we arrived we were told that we did not have a reservation. I had to open up my laptop to proove to the reception that we did infact have a reservation even ater I rang ahead 3 days prior to confirm my booking and add an extra bed for my son. The room they gave us we had to talk them into making up 2 single beds into the double that we booked. The room was nice & clean. The bathroom also clean but the shower flooded out of the door. It was becoming painful to mop up the flood after each shower. We had to order additional towels morning & night just to control the water coming out of the shower. The breakfast staff were so rude. They told us to move tables as they wanted to clean up one side of the room, they started to remove the food before 10.30am each morning as though they could not wait to get out of there. They even told a couple of families who turned up at 10.30 to go and order food from the bar. They were just plain rude. We felt them looking at us each morning trying to stare us out of the room. We tried to have our laundry done on saturday to be told to bring it down the next day. On sunday we were told that there is no laundry done on sundays. On the Monday we bought it down at 10.15am to be told that it was too late and should have been at reception before 10am, they could only manage to have it ready for Tuesday night after we needed to check out to catch our plane. We ended up just taking it back to our room & wasing it in the basin. It was like thay just did not want to deal with any laundry. Having said all of this. I did speak to a couple of ladies at the reception who were very helpful & co-operative. If you can only dela with the ladies I am sure you would enjoy a more plesant stay than we had.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel, but some staff not friebdly.”
Reviews.Author: Desdrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great clean and close to transport. We stayed 5 nights from 25 to 30 July 2010 and found the reception staff very friendly and helpful but the restaurant staff and batman just seemed like they wished we would just go away. The restaurant is open 6:30 to 9:30PM we arrived for dinner at 8:30 the restaurant was empty and the staff looked at us as if to say what do you mean arriving at this time. We order our meal and as we were eating one staff member just stood there watching and looking at his watch, like to say hurry up want to go home, felt not welcome at all. One afternoon we went to the bar to ask for some ice, the barman was reading the newspaper and when we asked for some ice he threw down the paper and stormed off into the cooler and retuned with some ice that he just threw onto the counter all the time not a word said. They need some serious customer service training. As I said at the begining the reception staff were fantastic, petty that didn't flow through to the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID HOTEL - OR WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS AT ALL TIMES”
Reviews.Author: jstroh_7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from July 1st to July 5th, 2010. On the morning of July 2nd my wife and I were downstairs having a quick breakfast. In a span of about fifteen minutes a hotel employee decided to rifle through my wife's purse which she left in the room and help themself to $120. We noticed immediately that someone had been in our room (although they decided not to clean the room, but just steal our money). We reported the theft immediately to the hotel staff. The purse was left in our hotel room while we were at breakfast and only hotel employees had access to the room at the time as later verified by hotel electronic records. The manager refused to assist or believe us and initially discouraged us from reporting the incident to police before finally giving us the police station information. We later spoke with the hotel president, Mr. Fabrizio Roscioli, that evening. He told us to obtain a police report and that we would be reimbursed for our loss through the hotel's insurance coverage, but to date, although we provided our e-mail, phone number, and mailing address, to the hotel, we have not heard anything. This is a common scam in Rome - while we were at the police station a Japanese lady there had $2000 euros taken from her luggage at her hotel. Every hotel will deny it was their employee who always is their best employee of thirty years, etc.; and the hotel will make you think it was your fault or that you are remembering wrong. Don't believe the hotel's excuses, and better yet don't stay at this hotel and avoid the risk of something like this ruining your trip as it did ours, where you feel like at any time the hotel employees can take whatever they want. I can only assume that the hotel decided to keep the insurance proceeds for themselves as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: anchorcity
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Universo and would recommend this place to any friends or family who are going to Rome as a comfortable and clean base in a good location for getting around the city. I had to smile at the review below about being asked, during check-in, if we wanted to book a taxi to take us back to the airport at the end of our stay. This did surprise us at the time, especially the fact that when we said no the response was one of astonishment that we didn't want to pay 30 Euros for a taxi. Why would we when the 4 Euro airport shuttle from Termini is only a couple of minutes walk away? I think maybe the staff are on commission with a taxi firm because on another occassion I asked a staff member if he knew what number bus I needed to take to get to a well known landmark and he recommended that I take a taxi - in the end I found the bus by myself quite easily. Apart from the hard sell on taxi services I was very happy with the staff and found them to be friendly. Our room was average sized, but nicely decorated and very clean and quiet. The bathroom was large with a great power shower. Best of all was the air con - I'd been warned that Rome is sweltering in July, but I hadn't appreciated how draining the heat was going to be. To be able to come back to a cool room after a day of melting outside was just bliss. Mini bar and bar prices were very reasonable. Breakfast was good with a varied choice of the usual buffet selection of pastries, cereals, breads, fruit, yoghurt, bacon, eggs and sausages. We had no problems with getting a table straight away even though we were going down for breakfast at about 08:30, a time we normally find to be quite busy at other hotels. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a clean and comfortable base that is very easy to find when you arrive in a strange city and one that is very convenient for the underground station, tram and bus stops. It is also reasonably easy to walk from the hotel to most of the major sights, though probably a lot easier during cooler months. It would probably take about 20 minutes to walk to Trevi Fountain if you didn't need to keep stopping for a rest and a drink on the way. For younger travellers who like a loud and lively nightlife I would probably not recommend the Universo - somewhere nearer to Castel St Angelo or the island in the Tiber might be be a better base. Though there are quite a few bars and restaurants around the Universo area, it is very quiet compared to the nightlife down by the river. That was party central!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute Woderful expereince - thanks Mario”
Reviews.Author: SohailOmar
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and I must say that the hotel made it absolutely wonderful. The room was not ready when we checked in but after that everything was amazing. I must commend Mario at the front desk who was absolutely fantastic. From helping with the room (we got a great one on the 7th floor) , to chalking out a tour of the city and helping with the Eurail etc etc, he made everything great for us. One of the friendliest people I have ever met. The room was great with a nice balcony and a great bathroom. Everything was well attended and the room was cleaned well every day. We were in Rome for 2 days only and the location of the hotel (right next to Termini station) made the travelling very easy. Mario recommneded a private tour of the city which was a bit pricey but well worth it in the end. We are glad we took it. This was our 10th anniversary celebration and Universo was a great choice. We will definitely come again and recommend the hotel to everyone. Mario - we hope to see you in Pakistan soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, except for Mario at the front desk and other staff”
Reviews.Author: kellenwood
Reviews.Content: The place itself has many positives, but unfortunately what i will remember is the rude, insensitive, gruff staff. The only friendly faces were the employees who cleaned our rooms. Mario at the front desk was a rude, demeaning man who offered none of the Roman hospitality that the literature boasted. The staff in the breakfast buffet were pretty cold and not helpful. We suggested that our tour company not use this hotel again until they were all properly in-serviced on common courtesy and manners.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: jhydroxy
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was just a few blocks from the train station and a 15-20 min walk to all the key sites in Rome ( Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc). The hotel was nicely air conditioned (rare for Europe) with a fitness center downstairs, an awesome restaurant, free room service and really modern comfortable rooms. In addition, the staff was really helpful and friendly. One of the front desk agents recommended an awesome restaurant downtown and highlighted the route on the map of where to go. This was my favorite hotel of my trip to Italy and would recommend it to anyone who stays in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Not too sure about this one....”
Reviews.Author: traveljulie
Reviews.Content: US travel agent who assured us it would be great. Price was good, but we were separated from our children's room by the entire floor, while the other two groups in our party were adjacent to them. Simply too tired upon arrival to make a fuss with the front desk staff about that and knew from their snarly faces that they wouldn't change us anyway. Coffee makers not in room and when given one it did not work. The room was small but clean and the bath very nice. Our daughter's room was huge. Breakfast was a nice plus but it was good one day and only average the next. Four night stay, would probably look elsewhere if we go back to Rome. The worst thing though was their tolerance of smoking -- were supposed to be smoke free floor (entire hotel?) and was definitely not. Both husband and I came home with respiratory issues -- either mold in the building or too much smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and newly redecorated rooms”
Reviews.Author: iridiscent
Reviews.Content: All-in-all, a great hotel for travellers who want no-nonsense. The rooms are spacious (for European standards), the bathrooms are huge, there is free in-room internet (ethernet cable provided for laptops) and best of all, it is a 3 minute walk to the Stazione Termini. I was a bit worried when I read all the reviews citing poor staff attitude but alas, they were confirmed as true. One man at reception was extremely rude and snarky, answering every question with a "I don't know" or "no". Very unpleasant and not what you'd look forward to at the beginning of a trip. However, if you're willing to look past some grumpiness, I would definitely recommend this hotel for its value, location and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barry51555
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The room was fine and it even had a balcony. The breakfast buffet was great and included in the price.The street was ok but a few blocks away was iffy. The first morning i was accosted by a gypsy gang down the block. I also saw them numerous times after that so watch out!!The staff was nice although the evening shift features a cranky old guy who says no to all your requests and acts like you're bothering him while he has more important things to do. All in all not bad for a Best Western

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Lots of other hotels to try, NOT this one”
Reviews.Author: guardineer
Reviews.Content: Good location, although a long walk from St Peter's. The staff were frequently quite rude and uncooperative, to our group members throughout the fews days. They tolerated the guests, but did not make them welcome. Only one room key was allowed, even though we were two to a room. Basic bkfst before 7am. Number of times we gathered in the foyer to start a tour and were "shushed" several times by the staff. problems with internet were not politely solved. One man particularly seem to be obnoxious, and spent time across the street in a shop, talking to the young lady. Charged for room internet. Lots of other hotels to try, NOT this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: aarondent
Reviews.Content: If you were to read about this hotel on the net, you would think this is going to be one awesome experience. Alas! There is a gap between reality and perception. Firstly, this is not a 4 star hotel. 3 and 1/2 stars at best. The lobby smacks of past glory, but now appears rather run down. The rooms are better. However, they could do with more light. We were just two to a room but were given these split-level rooms with the beds on top - rather inconvenient. The area where the beds are is extremely congested. I would have expected much more.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Anonytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights booked through Alpha Rooms, who stated that rooms booked were superior, they were not!. We have stayed at Best Western Hotels several times and never had to ask for tea and coffee facilities in the room, our room was on the small side, dark, as it was at the back of the hotel although very quiet. modern rooms, although our carpet showed signs of wear and appeared quite grubby, limited wardrobe space, although our sons room had a full length wardrobe ours did not. so I do think the rooms vary. Lovely modern bathroom although our shower showed signs of repair and had been resealed ariund the shower tray, without success and leaked out onto the bathroom tiles when shower in use. Reception staff very busy but were never rude, although we chose not to ask for information due to past reports on this forum. Bar and mini bar reasonably priced, very nice buffet breakfast. good selection/ choice. Location - as stated by other visitors hotel very near bus/train station, a good 30 mins walk to colloseum, crossing roads and risking your life ! even when you have right of way ! .be careful. If I was to choose a location again to stay I would choose the Trevi fountain region, plenty of restaurants bars, shops and sites all within walking distance and a good atmosphere. although this does reflect in the price and availability. overall The price we paid for this hotel was reasonable but would not choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes away from main train station”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCanadaGirl
Reviews.Content: I took the train in from Florence, and was able to walk the 5 or 6 minutes to the hotel. My room was quite big, free Internet, nice breakfast, and enjoyed my chat with the friendly bar man! I would stay again if had the change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathy88_97
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Universo. The room was a nice size as was the bathroom. They had a very friendly hotel staff. I can't really comment on the other amneties of the hotel because we were there only to sleep at night - the days were spent walking around Rome. The continental breakfast was also great. It was nice to enjoy a complimentary breakfast before heading off for our adventures in Rome. The internet provided by the hotel was not available from 12am to 8am. This hotel may not be in the heart of Rome but it was only a couple blocks from the Termini Station. We bought the Roma Pass which is good for three days - you can ride the metro and buses with this pass (along with free admission to the colosseum and forum). Overall we had a great time in Rome and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for great location”
Reviews.Author: mindfultraveller
Reviews.Content: Had booked for kingsize bed but first sent to a small dark room with twin beds, went back to desk got small dark room with double bed, but on 3rd try got large bright room with kingsize bed. They were very busy at the time but if I would have settled for original room I would not have been happy. The hotel rate included a breakfast buffet was that was extensive. Eggs, bacon, sausages ,pastries sliced meats and cheese, fruit. You could actually toast your own toast and there was good coffe and juice. The hotel is a short walk from the main train station Roma Termini. You can get a direct train from the airport to there or take a cab to the hotel for a set rate of 40 Euro. (make sure you get in one of the offical white cabs). Also the hop on off bus tours stop in this area. Mario on the front desk arranged a very competive rate for our group of 8 to Civitavecchia to catch our cruise ship , plus had suggestions for good places to eat in the area of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel of our whole trip!”
Reviews.Author: snedds24
Reviews.Content: The worst feature of this hotel is their staff. They are extremely unfriendly, unhelpful and borderline rude at all times. We chose to stay at this hotel due to its close proximity to the railway station, however as there are many other hotels in the area this is no real bonus. We arrived at the Universo Hotel at around 1.30pm, and check in is at 2pm. As we were early the staff basically did not want to deal with us and almost demanded that we 'go and have lunch' and come back at check-in time. However it was fasinating to see that a couple off the street who were paying cash received a room straight away, and pre-paid customers (over the internet) are sent away. Once we were able to check-in we were served by Ann Marie F. who did not want to provide any assistance whatsoever, in regard to questions about the area, tours etc, I was once again sent away. This was general service at the hotel no matter who you spoke to, they just don't want to deal with any customer enquiries, especially if you speak english. The buffet breakfast is awful. The room is very average and everyday when we came back to room it never looked like it had been cleaned properly, the beds were made, but there would always be stuff left on the floor and the bedside table was never wiped down. Tea and coffee making facilities are not in the room, but they are available on request. However housekeeping never replaced any tea/coffee and did not clean the cups! So we took it upon ourselves to swap them at breakfast, rather than have to talk to the staff. On top of all of this, this hotel advertises they have air conditioning. There is NO AIR CONDITIONING! This hotel only provides air conditioning at certain times of the year (this is apparently due to Italian law), however they really should be upfront with their customers and make them aware of this, before they book. When we enquired about this the staff were unapologetic and would not provide a fan for the room. They suggested we open a window, which is makes it impossible to sleep because there is so much street noise. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: LindaLancaster_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff and restaurant staff were not just rude, but insulting. Never been treated like this anywhere we have traveled. Could not believe the arrogance and lack of professionalism. The restaurant was never open promptly in the morning and the hot food was never put out on time. Hence several mornings all we had was cold cereal with no milk. We stayed for 4 days and asked for wake up calls of which we received only one, even though they were asked repeatedly to do so.
