Desk staff were confrontational and rude no matter what time of day you approached the desk. Restaurant's food at dinner was poor at best. Not only would I not stay at this hotel ever again, it is very doubtful that I would consider ANY Best Western ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated Pleasant Hotel with Large Rooms and Baths”
Reviews.Author: TravelSmart0745
Reviews.Content: You will be comfortable at this hotel. The rooms and baths are large; cleaning service is excellent. It is relatively quiet in busy, central Rome, therefore a very good location to stay for sightseeing. The main Metro terminal is a short walk away. Breakfast is entirely adequate and complimentary. There is a free Internet connection in the lobby and rooms are wired for the Internet. One caution: should you need to telephone the USA, the hotel phones offer a "1508" access code. While the connection is fast and clear, the charge for a timed brief call of two or theee minutes is over $40 usd. Use your ATT card for international calls and save.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, centrally located, perfect for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: antnlou
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 12:30 and were informed the room was not going to be ready until 2pm which was fine as that is the same for basically every hotel. We left the bags in reception and went out into Rome. The concierge was very helpful with tips on how to get around the city so we opted with the open top bus tour that he recommended. We checked in later that day and found the room to be very modern and clean. It was small but all we needed for the weekend. Our room was on the top floor and had a balcony with a decent view. Breakfast buffet was nice too Hotel also organised a car to the airport for us I would stay here again the next time we visit Rome.I would also recommend this to anyone going.

Reviews.Title: “Good ,affordable hotel with ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: AlanGIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for our 2nd wedding anniversary in the last weekend in March 2010 . Location is great as its only 5 min walk from Termini (Central train station ). We planned all our trips through here by using the Leonardo express for the airport, Metro / bus service(Stazione ) to get around the city. (You pay €4 for a daily pass to use the city metro / bus service , which is very good) As for the hotel we arrived around midday . I was disappointed that we had to wait around till 2pm until the room was available . This wasted time as we were on a fairly tight schedule for our weekend break . We went across the street to a cafe / restaraunt but beware when you sit outside you pay through the roof for drinks . Coffee was €5 !!!! (When you are after arriving from a colder climate with the weather nicer , its easy to fall into this trap ) Our Room in the hotel was clean and recently refurbished . Beds were not the most comfortable and its 2 x singles joined together to make a double . We were on the 5th floor and the windows can open completly . Not ideal for kids from a safety point of view !!! Shower head was broken but this was a minor problem. Dont think food was being served in the hotel either night we were there . THE Bar was empty also but at least the drinks were cheaper than what we were paying when we were out and about . Overall we really enjopyed our time in this city and i would recommend this hotel as it was quite affordable €99 per night with breakfast and also for its ideal location to explore Rome .

Reviews.Title: “We Came, We Saw, We Stayed”
Reviews.Author: mike1973Lancs_UK
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Universo initially because it offered a competitive price for the length of our stay-4 nights mid March 2010-and we were on a budget having spent the first week in Italy in Sorrento. The hotel was a five minute walk from the busy Terminii metro/rail/bus station.We had one of the en-suite bedrooms on the 7th floor-you get a nice balcony to sit out on, although the view of the opposite hotel roofs isnt much to look at, you do get the sound and feel of Rome. The room was compact, however it had wireless internet, satellite tv (only three english channels-CNN,Sky and BBC News) pay-tv and a well stocked-very cheap minibar-alcohol is just two euros! Room service is free, and reasonably priced too. The bed was a king sized double, the en-suite has a shower-no bath and is very stylish. Overall a very clean room, if a bit small-but then you aren't going to be in your room other to sleep and rest, and most of the hotels in Rome are similarly sized it seems. It was not a problem. We did not require the air con, since it was around 20C during the day, and 10C at night-we found we could sleep with the balcony door open-it just beecomes noisy around 7am when Rome's famous traffic gets busy! The staff were very polite, courteous and helpful, they spoke excellent english-although i prefer to speak Italian in Italy and it is always well-received by the natives, your pronunciation may make them smile but they are grateful if you make the effort. This is primarily a business-minded hotel, it is in a very business-dominated area. Having said that, the hotel breakfast caters very well for all styles, american, continental european or a full english breakfast, it is excellent value. They have a lunch menu, you need to pre-book this or they cannot serve you on an impromptu visit. We dined in the evening restaurant-it was totally empty! The food was excellent, and reasonably priced considering Rome's restaurants are famously expensive! I recommend the 'set' menu. It seemed the hotel do not advertise their menu to anyone outside the hotel, which is a shame. The cocktail bar was busier!! Overall, an excellent stay and very good value for money-it was technically the 'low' season and there are good deals to be had. The hotel arranged our airport transfer too, a very smart Mercedes limousine, a friendly driver called Adriano, smartly dressed and very professional-45 euros for the service, a flat rate regardless of passengers and baggage. Fiumicino is around 30km away but it is driveable in around 30 minutes. You could take the cheaper 'leonardo Express' train from the Terminii but it means more hassle lugging your baggage around on a busy station. Rome itslef is wonderful, you need a 3 night stay to soak up the sights, all the Roman ruins etc are within walking distance...from the hotel walk to Piazza della Repubblica, take Via Nazionale and you will see the main tourist sights...the Colosseum is nearby, or two stops from the Terminii by metro. I recommend paying 19 euros, obtaining a city sightseeing tourbus-the ticket is hop-on/off, lasts for 48 hrs. well worth it for seeing the whole city and the Vatican too, or your feet will get very tired!! There is so much to see. Avoid at all costs the tourist areas if you get hungry, they will rip you off pricewise. Be cautious, hunt down the side streets, ask the locals and you will find many gems where to eat, and save your cash too. Use trattorias, pizzerias if you like a starter, pasta/pizza and a desert. Wine is much cheaper than beer, plus the bottles are bigger too! At the Vatican City, avoid the so-called 'tour-guides', touting for business. The queues to get into the St Peters Basilica can be around a 30 min wait, but it is FREE to get in. The touts charge 25 euros each and take you to the gate. Not worth it at all. Once in, take the Cupola tour-you will need to be fit and not claustrophobic! You can climb 550 steps to the top of the Dome-the 360 degree view is awesome at 450 ft above St Peter's!!...you can pay for a lift, but you still climb 220 steps on anarrow spiral staircase-it can make you hot, dizzy and light-headed. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mumshopping4me
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Universo for three nights in Feb. We arrived late and were helped to find a garage to park the car within minutes of pulling up out the front. Checked in and after a month of staying in european hotels were pleased with the modern decor and comfortable bed. No matter where you stay it is the little things that make the difference. Internet into the rooms was free, went down to the bar and asked for ice -no problem. Asked the front desk for advice on local cafes, the lovely older gentleman who spoke faultless English gave us advice on local eateries ranging in price, style quality etc. In the morning rang room service for coffee brought to the room quickly - no charge. Asked for advice on local transport and directions, a map was produced, highlighted and the same gentleman actually came from behind the desk walked us outside and pointed us in the right direction. Fantastic location, great staff, comfortable room well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: adisom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in march 07 as well as 09 on a bed and breakfast basis,nice and clean hotel, although there was a strong smell of what i can describe as fishy in our room on a couple of occassions. A mix up with the rooms on our second visit when booking in and the staff looked very confused took a while to sort out ,plenty of variety for breakfast,easy access to the train station and plenty of restaurants around the area although quite expensive,never got around to eating dinner at the hotel so cannot comment,The alcohol was reasonably priced so we drank at the hotel most evenings,Most of the staff were fine, there was a night manager or porter orvill the duck my mate reckoned he looked like who had a stinking attitude and didnt like to see people enjoying their break,but overall apart from "orvilles" attitude we enjoyed our stay. Although it was very noisy in the mornings with outside traffic but i suppose it is a busy city hotel after all.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gattidiroma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and overall we enjoyed our stay. The room was a bit small but it was not a major problem. Everything was clean. The breakfast was included in the price, which was also a plus. Breakfast itself was decent, but nothing to shout about. Remarkably for Rome, the coffee was certainly the worst we ever had. The room itself was comfortable, and reasonably quiet. The location of the hotel is also convenient - within walking distance of all major attractions of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: going-around-10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to Roma termini (train station) which was very convenient for us. Despite that, we could walk safely at night and had no problem at all. It's very close to Santa maria Maggiore and we just walked to most places in Rome. The rooms are very nice, very good size and bathroom is very clean. I'm quite picky about that and I have nothing to complain about. The room is very quiet thanks to the double glazed windows. Breakfast was very good with fresh fruits, juice, eggs, bread, etc. The staff was very nice, specially the guy who delivered room service at night and a lady in the front desk. She was extremely helpful with everything we needed! Some rooms have play station which the kids appreciated having something to do at night. The only complaint I have is that we could hear every noise in the corridor when people walked there speaking loud. The doors should be thicker. I don't know why, and I've never seen this before, but the cleaning ladies were just in front of my room on the first floor as early as 7:00 to 7:30 in the morning! And they talked as loud as if they were at home! I woke up every morning with them talking a lot and loudly. Cleaning service should begin later than that! and they did not need to make all that noise. But I think this is something the manager could fix and I would stay there again if this does not happen.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: xinari1878
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome for the first time a few days ago. We had an amazing time and were very happy with the hotel which we stayed in for 5 nights. The hotel was simple yet provided for all our needs. The location was the best we could have hoped for ideally situated between Termini station and Piazza Republica. The rooms were small yet provided for all our needs, they were well kept, modern, the bed was very comfortable and the shower was just amazing. Breakfast was decent, staff were friendly, the cleaning team were disappointing on some issues(eg:when cleaning our room they wouldnt change dirty tea cups) another minus was the fact that there was no safety box in the room and we would need to keep going to reception when needing cash. Would definately come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you're not on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: mehow
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy to find, especially if you have late-night flight and are transferring to Termini. Our room was of decent size, clean, with modern design. Check-in and check-out wery smooth. Breakfast was very good compared to other Italian hotels but would be nice if included also some vegetables and fresh juice. Overall - yep, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: vanessa_vanessa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Universo for 3 nights and enjoyed it very much. The location is just great, very near to Termini and also Piazza Republica. The staff was nice. Our room was not very big, but new, well decorated and with modern interesting details. The bathroom was brand new, very good and pretty. The breakfast was reasonable, not very diversified. Very good choice, would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Per0xide
Reviews.Content: *Very clean hotel * great buffet breakfast * staff were occasionally helpful, did spend a long time trying to find someone who was willing to show how a telephone card works and also to be able to check in as soon as we arrived. was made to wait 2 hours to check in. that was a big inconvenience. especially after a 24 hour flight. *good location - plenty of cafes, close to attractions, 5 minutes from termini train station. * special mention for concierge - Mario. Was excellent with customer service. He made sure we had a pleasant stay and greeted us every morning :o)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLulu1984
Reviews.Content: This was a nice simple hotel, very nice reception area and the staff where fairly friendly. The hotel is just off a main road so it was rather noisey, the windows didn't seem to be double glazed so we often got an early wake up call from A LOT of car horns. But we needed to start each day early anyway so that wasn't too much of a problem. The hotel is near some great restaurants and bars, and a 10/15 min walk to the Coliseum and the Forum. Our room was cleaned every day and we had a very friendly cleaner who greeted us with a smile every day. The breakfast buffet had a very wide selection and ono ur last day we discovered you can have breakfast delivered to your room free of charge! This was a great service as it meant we didn't have to rush to get a good table on the dining room. We ordered a room with a double bed but we just got a room with two single beds pushed together, I found myself stuck down a hole between the two when I woke up in the morning. The reception staff were very helpful when we wanted to book a bus tour, we could purchase tickets from the hotel, the bus stop was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We were also given a map of Rome when we arrived free of charge. I would say the hotel is fairly good value for money. I personally would probably stay somewhere a bit cheaper if I were to visit Rome again, as we weren't in the hotel much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff near Termini train station!”
Reviews.Author: FoxMor4
Reviews.Content: Universo is a 3 minute walk from the Termini train staion. The reception staff & porters were very cordial, helpful & spoke excellent English. My husband and my 2 young adult daughters were very comfortable in the nicely appointed rooms (1 king room & a room with 2 twin beds). The rooms & baths were modern, roomy, very comfortable, clean & quiet. There was ample closet space and space for our large suitcases & totes! The baths were very spacious, but had glass enclosed showers only. We all enjoyed the daily breakfast buffet which offered a great selection of both hot and cold breakfast fare, fresh fruits, pastries, etc. There was a large seating capacity, so we never felt cramped at breakfast. The elevator is on the ground floor, so you do not need to climb steps. With prior warnings of Rome's hotels being small, we were absolutely delighted with the size and spaciousness of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a **** (Four Star) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luluc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights (pre-paid and chosen by Tour Operator) - at first glance hotel was decent and very good location near Termini, walking distance to major streets and sites- but upon checking in we were greeted by rude and unhelpful reception desk. Maybe because we were a large tour group?? DO NOT be billeted at the 1st floor-rooms not well maintained - musky rooms and toilet- no individual safes and NO REFRIGERATOR! FOUR STARS THEY SAY?? Reception personnel very biased as polite and helpful with Caucasians but being an Asian they were very impatient and unhelpful. They only "softened up" when our tour leader threatened to report their behaviour to management. The good thing is they agreed to our changing rooms to one that has a refrigerator and we were pleasantly surprised to see a large well lit room but when the outside temperature got cooler without warning they turned off the air conditioning and room became so hot we had to open the windows When we complained they told us "no aircon cos not working - something wrong with airconditioning" - ya right!!! When we reported that our telephone in the room was not working they did not take our word for it until we saw a filipino staff-Raul-who checked and changed it immediately as it was defective.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: kgholtz
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was near the train station. We used BW points, so I'm not sure exactly how much the hotel costs. It was very nice, clean, roomy (which you usually do not see in European hotels). The breakfast was very good with a very helpful staff. Our room was ready upon arrival at 10am which was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff and service! (Rob UK)”
Reviews.Author: harmey101
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from staying at the Universo Hotel with my girlfriend, and felt I should post an honest review. Location excellent, 20 mins max from colleseum, 30 mins trevi fountain, in fact very close to all tourist sites, most of all 5 min walk from the train station (Termini stazione) where all buses lead to! In fact only took one bus and that was to the Vactican (but walked back) Hotel: Very clean and comfortable, worthy of it's star rating, staff were excellent, no need to buy a map just ask the staff they give you one and mark where to go and how to get there! Bar very nice and only 3 Euros for a beer (elsewhere varies from 5-10 euros) Breakfast was good with plenty of choice, and of excellent quality. The best thing about this hotel was the staff without a doubt, they really couldn't do enough for you. The room was very modern,immaculate and had an excellent shower, well needed after walking round all day. Air con worked fine (leave at low speed for less noise) Down side of the stay... getting the hang of the pedestrian crossings and of course coming home! I'm not normally one to write reviews but definetly beleive this hotel is worth a stay in. (and worth the cost) dont miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, overpriced, overrated.”
Reviews.Author: PatmiddleEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. Good central position for transport and sightseeing, but not good value for money. Cooked breakfast ghastly, continental offering boring - cheap 'ham' and tinned peaches! Coffee awful. Room reasonable size but design all form and no function. Air con didn't work for 2 days, and bathroom flooded every time you had a shower. Bed comfortable. Restaurant deserted in evening, probably as it was expensive for a mediocre meal.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated..Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: msiso
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in early September..Very very short walk from the train station which was great since we arrived late at night. The neighborhood around the train station is not the most pleasant, comparable to Chinatown in NYC but I am from NYC so i did not mind. We had requested a non-smoking room which we got but when we went to the room it reaked of smoke. We were switched to another room but with 2 single beds instead of one. When I told the bellboy about the situation he did not seem to care and just told me it would be taken care of in the morning. I was a little annoyed at that because I requested a kind bed but was not in the mood to switch rooms again. The rooms seemed very newly renovated and were very nicely decorated. I especially liked the bathroom. The breakfast in the morning was pretty good compared to other hotels we stayed in. The lobby and hotel staff were excellent. Definetly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “adequate accomodation with some very surly staff”
Reviews.Author: paul026
Reviews.Content: Rome is a captivating city with tourists coming and going into various hotels 24/7. The Universo came into that category and at all times of the day and night, tour groups arrived and went. To some of the staff of this hotel thats exactly what they were-----TOUR GROUPS that seemed to weary and bore them. Some of the front of house and restaurant staff, did not have a problem letting you know in both their demeanour and attitude that they found you an inconvenience. At best they were unhelpful, at worst surly rude, indifferent, lacking basic good manners and showing neither personality or care. The hotel management should ask some of the male reception staff to diversify their skills into other area's of the hotel's operation like computers or accounts, were they wont be bothered or inconvenienced by the hotels guests. Life is full of choices. If you dont like people dont work in hospitality. I and many of the group I was part off had no problem with the accomodation provided. It was clean comfortable and of a four star standard. The breakfast was also excellent and of good quality and variety. The housekeeping staff also provided a great service, were pleasant, engaging and polite. Some of male reception staff of this hotel could learn from their good manners. Tour Groups are made up of various people of all ages with different needs and expectations. In so far as a hotel is required to provide good accomodation the Universo meets that expecation, but my abiding memory will be its surly unhelpful and noticably, unhappy staff, some of whom were unforgiveably downright rude.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini and all the comforts of a US hotel”
Reviews.Author: UMD_Grad_Student
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very Euro hotel, this one may not be for you. If you are looking for the creature comforts and pleasant design you are used to seeing in large city hotels back home, this should definitely be a contender. Hotel is a short walk from Termini. The neighborhood is slighlty suspect, but there are enough small restaurants and other tourists around that we never felt unsafe. Rooms were big enough, the bathroom was super modern, and we even had a balcony. Beds were very firm, yet comfortable. Breakfast is included, and was in a large tourist-filled room that was a little bright and busy for us late sleepers. They had scrambled eggs, meats, pastries, cereal, etc. There was also a feature that I WISH all US hotels had- you could place your breakfast order for room service FREE and have them deliver at whatever time you wanted in the morning. The list had everything they served downstairs. We didn't take advantage of this feature, but I thought it was really cool. We were able to leave our bags at the front counter without any problems for a full 8 hour day while we contined to see the sights in Rome. Definitely appreciated the design and ease of staying at this hotel. May check out another place off the subway in Rome next time, but if I needed somewhere near Termini, this would be my spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: berlinblade
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight into Rome arriving at the hotel around 10 AM. We were planning on leaving our bags and doing some sightseeing, but the hotel staff was nice enough to let us check-in when we arrived. The female (Marie) who helped us was very friendly, spoke English well while the two guys we dealt with had an OK understanding of English. They didn't have a non-smoking room at that time like we had requested, but gave us the option to take what's available, and change rooms the following day or to wait until one became available on that day. When we went to the room, we could harly smell the smoke, so we ended up staying in the same room our entire stay. Like everyone here had said the Termini station is less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Along the way, there are plenty of restaurants including the Washington's Bar just a few doors down from the hotel. There's even a souvenir shop across the street, and the Scooter rental shop is less than 5 minutes away. We had bought the Roma Pass so we took the metro everywhere and didn't walk to any of the sights from the hotel. The breakfast was good, again like everyone said, it gets boring after a couple of days because it's the same items everyday. The room has a mini bar, but it had no safe (one available at the front desk), no iron (one available at the fronk desk), and no coffeemaker, and only Italian power outlets. The room we had looked exactly like the one in the hotel pictures. It was very clean and a good size in comparison to European hotel rooms. The housekeeping is very efficient that by the time we came back from breakfast on the first day, the room had been cleaned so we couldn't even leave her a tip like we normally do. The next day we left her a tip, and she had left us a handwritten thank you note. Overall, we had a wonderful time at the hotel and Rome. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good breakfast, walking distance to the Train Station & sites”
Reviews.Author: BebeTerry
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, bathrooms are very clean, breakfast is great, buffet style, staff is kind and helpful - would recommend to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: logan33961
Reviews.Content: Situated 2 blocks away from termini. I felt very safe with my wife and daughter walking at night. About 15-20 minutes walk to Colosseo and Piazza Venizia. The room was small but cozy and clean, breakfast was great. Very helpful staffs. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: VicAlan07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in May and would happily stay again. The rooms were spacious, the breakfast was yum, and the staff were friendly and helpful. You could walk to a lot of Rome's attractions from here but we chose to use the hop on hop off bus which had a stop just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in the center of the city, 2mn walk from Termini”
Reviews.Author: troch
Reviews.Content: I've been a few times at the Universo this last 6 months for business. Before to find Universo, I have tried some other hotels around Termini but I've never found a so good place. Staff is professionnal, Rooms are large, bathrooms are delightfull, very clean, very well equiped, beds are very cumfortable, breakfast is served in the room at the same price than in the breakfast area (this is rare and need to be pointed out), and, cherry on the cake, even if you are working during the day, you can enjoy sauna and turkish baths and fitness center as it's open from 7AM to 9PM. Even if you are in the crowded center of the city, when you close the windows it's very quiet and fresh with or without Conditionned Air.

Reviews.Title: “Fully renovated, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: aybc
Reviews.Content: Stay was one week. This is an EXCELLENT hotel for the money. All rooms renovated in a Westin Hotel style. Floor 7 rooms have a private balcony with A+ Rome views. Bathroom was new and marble with tub/shower. Bed was great! Location by Termini Train Station made day travel a breeze. On a nice street with other tourist hotels and resturants. Flat screen TV in rooms with pay movies in English. Main complaint was only 3 free English TV stations and the front desk staff which tended to be a bit snitty.

Reviews.Title: “spacious room and big tv”
Reviews.Author: audmonamikaela
Reviews.Content: our room was spacious and had a big tv..the hotel is centrally located..10 to 15 minutes walk from the train station..the breakfast was good, many to choose, the staff spoke english, restaurant served sumptous food even though we came there late, there was a gym but we were not able to use it, internet cafes outside and some food shops, mini library in the main hall....negative things were 1. we heard the noise from the hall or from the other room esp. late at night...2. there was a man selling souvenirs in the hall, bit annoying..

Reviews.Title: “Was an ok hotel- not 4 star quality though”
Reviews.Author: lOVEMYLUXURY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. Location is quite good- bvery close to Termini (the main train station) on a nice enough street with other hotels. The staff were generally very nice and helpful other than 1 guy with glasses who worked at night- he was so bloody rude, arrougant and unhelpful. One the first night, the electricity went while i was in the shower- I rang down to reception and he said he's get a porter up- half an hour later, i rang again as no one had come, he told me that the porters were busy and someone would be up in half an hour! I ended up going out with my hair wet, no make up or anything as room was in darkness. The room was very small - not 4 star quality, but clean and done the job, The bed squeaked a ot and everytime I moved it hit off the headboard making a huge bang. Lifts took an waful long time, breakfast was good. The hotel advertises as having Turkish baths- I went down the first night,a nd it wasnt on.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant spot to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: dilinger
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at Universo. Location is perfect being around the corner from the main Termini (including both metro lines) and easy walk to Coliseum, ancient Rome, Spanish steps etc... Very nice room with lovely bathroom. Very clean. Friendly staff. Breakfast was fine but got a bit repetitive as we were there for 8 days. Only complaints would be that they would only issue one room card which was a pain when we wanted to do separate stuff and charging for Wifi. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “A recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: thecaribou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Universo in November 2007. We had a pleasant experience at this hotel. It is located very close to the Termini which makes all of Rome very accessible using both the bus and the metro. We arrived early in the morning after a terrible overnight train ride (as a result of the train strikes that were going on in France at that time, we were coming in from Paris), but were efficiently booked in and the staff actually checked us in a little earlier than the usual check in time. We had read review that the staff were rude at this hotel, but we saw no such thing. I wouldn't say they were friendly, but they were efficient enough. We were happy with our room. The room was spacious, as well as the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was decent, nothing spectacular. There is an internet cafe/money exchange place right opposite the hotel. Also if you walk out of the hotel doors, turn left, and turn another left and walk down about half a kilometer, you will find a department store. A tip, shop around for a good exchange rate for dollars if you are travelling from the USA, as we found different rates at different places. The worst place for money exchange are the touristy areas where they literally fleece you!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ck0_Sc0
Reviews.Content: the hotel is ideally located, 5 minutes from the trainstation. the rooms are equipped very beautiful and modern. Breakfast was ok. the staff is helpful - we could easily switch the room (air conditioning didn't always work). finally, i would go again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: fancy23
Reviews.Content: We had to wait for abaut 40 minutes for the room, because they culdn't fine our resevation, which was made 3 months in advance. The room was too small and to close to the elevator that had a terrible sound. Things disappear from the room and no body take any responsibillity.

Reviews.Title: “not again”
Reviews.Author: jillhou
Reviews.Content: We were very encouraged when we stepped into the hotel. We thought it would be a comfortable place to stay. We wouldn't say that now. Mario at the front desk was the rudest man we encountered in our 11 day vacation. Seems he thought we were there to make him happy! Bed was nice and comfortable. Room was a reasonable size. Bathroom was beautiful until you tried to use it. The shower leaked ALL over the tile floor making it unsafe to walk on or to use any electrical appliance (hair dryer!) A/C was available from 3 pm to 9 pm. Made the room at least bareable for going to sleep although you got hot in the early morning hours. When they advertise, they do not advertise that AC is only available at certain times.... Breakfast was NOT GOOD. First morning eggs were watery....I mean.... REALLY watery - like they were not even cooked. One morning, the milk was soured and they didn't seem in a big hurry to change it for us. Very inconsistent. One morning we had fresh fruit - not sure what happened after that. The Japanese tourists at this hotel seem to dominate when the food came out.....it would be gone in a flash. Not a great location unless you are planning on using the train termini a lot. VERY long walks to the center attractions. Would not stay here again although it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible ...”
Reviews.Author: AJD57
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with the same chain in Rome before and had no dramas at all - that property was full so we picked the Universo. Knowing that it was a hot and humid Roman summer we ensured that the property had air conditioning when booking - and even confirmed it at check in. We were lied to - the airconditioning did not work at all in our room. We reported it immediately and sought a room change to be advised that there ws no other room. We confirmed later that this was not the case. We perservered and again reported the inoperable air conditioning the next morning only to be ignored. We advised that we would be checking out only to be ignored again. We checked out and then were offered another room - too late they cried! Needless to say we were charged full rate for both days - very very disappointing given that the hotel simply did not provide the service promised. It was just too hard to argue the toss - we paid and will chalk this one up to experience - a bad one. By the by, the Star Hotel Metropole next door was absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: moritzchicago
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 nights at this hotel. It is centrally located only 2 minutes walk from central station "Termini". I had a double room for single use. The room was clean, there was absolutely no noise, very nice bathroom, comfortable bed. The only negative thing is that the hotel staff could be more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: Lossi
Reviews.Content: We had read mixed reviews about this hotel. we stayed 4 nights. our general comments are: Overall, it was ok but did not stack up to other accommodation on our trip through France, Italy and Greece. * the rooms were refurbished, however some aspects were poorly done - though were spacious enough, large beds and new tvs etc * no outlook from our room * noisy from window and hallway * breakfast was below average - poor quality and no variety. not fresh * though centrally located to the main terminal, it was not within walking distance to any of the main attractions and we felt unsafe at times (we were travelling with infant) * rude service - from reception to concierge to breakfast staff Overall, it seemed like a decent business hotel however we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManU4Lyf
Reviews.Content: A party of 15 of us stayed in the hotel for a long weekend in Sept 07. Overalll we had an excellent time. The city was great and we were very impressed with the hotel. To be honest I had read a few bad reviews of the hotel before the trip but am happy to say that I had no need to worry as the hotel was excellent. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean. The staff were helpful and the breakfast was great. A very successful stress free holiday for all concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Rude personnel, breakfast sucks, noise - but near metro.”
Reviews.Author: tina099
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 7 nights (Apr 2008). There are some positive things, but also some really annoying things about this hotel. The negative points are: 1. The hotel is near a very central avenue, so sometimes it got a little difficult sleeping at night with all that noise. 2. We expected a more decent breakfast from a so-called 4-star hotel. The forks and knives were inside a cloth, which had turned into black from non-washing. The coffee machine was not working and the bread was not covered and had small flies moving around. But the most extreme thing I saw was that the man who was in charge of filling the food, every now and then took the used paper clothes from the empty tables, in order to clean the coffee machine and the juice machine!!! And when I say the used ones, I mean it!!! 3. While checking out, a problem appeared and the machine would not accept the credit card. My husband and I thought that maybe the amount was too big for just one card, so we asked the front desk clerk (a 55-year-old-man) to pass the card again, with a smaller amount this time (and the rest of the amount would be paid in cash). Immediately the man turned into red (!!) and started talking about us to his colleague in Italian, obviously disturbed. Then he turned to us and shouted that he cannot pass the card again, very impolite, as if we were beggars or something. We understood that there was no other way, so we asked him if we could use the free wi-fi internet of the lobby so as to transfer the money from a bank account. His answer was that if we wanted internet, we could go across the street to an internet cafe and pay for it!! Thankfully, my husband did not lose his patience, went to an ATM (cash point) and withdrew the amount, we paid them and our suffering finally ended. And now some positive stuff: 1. The hotel is two blocks away from Termini, the station of trains, buses and metro. 2. The room is very small, but nice and clean. I would definitely NOT choose to stay there again, unless they changed staff, noise and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Location - Location”
Reviews.Author: fendifendi
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Universo enjoys an excellent location in Roma. The entrance is not on one of the busier streets so it's safe to walk around the immediate area without the threat of heavy traffic. There are numerous small restaurants nearby - all with moderately priced tourist menus. The walk to the Termini Station with it's large bus terminal is easy. The tour bus companies also have their offices/destination point within a few blocks. The lobby is very large and has nice spacial features - but the red and black carpeting is unattractive and should be replaced. As requested, we were assigned a quiet room. It was large as was the bathroom - but the decor looked better on their website than in actuality. The beds were comfortable. The flooring treatment was made up of large squares of commerical quality carpet material - and it did not look like professionals installed it. The decor was stylish but not of good quality. The bathroom was royal blue and didn't coordinate with the bedroom scheme. The designers/renovators responsible don't get high marks for good design. Too bad - this hotel has good bones and could look great with better interior design. Check out the hotel next door for good design. The front desk night staff was excellent and also charming - the daytime staff was impersonal. The breakfast room also needs a better paint job - the color paint on the walls is not pleasant. The highlight of the breakfast was the flowing chocolate fountain machine and the huge bowls of fresh fruit to dip in the chocolate. The bartender was very cordial. Hint - Right near the hotel is the Palazzo Massimo - a wonderful museum with a superb Roman coin collection, Frescos and Mosiacs from Pompei and world class statues. There is a bus route at the Termini that takes a scenic route to the Vatican area -it also passes by the Pallazzo Narvonna area. * We contacted a private small bus shuttle back to the airport - cost 10 E less than the price quoted by the front desk staff for their recommended company.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Best Western Universo in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Geo2008
Reviews.Content: We recommend the Best Western Universo Hotel in Rome. Our stay there was very satisfactory and we actually extended our visit from 6 to 11 nights. The location is good - three blocks to Station Termini which has easy access to bus and train transport. There are several cafes and restaurants in the vicinity and good shopping is an easy walk away. We requested a quiet, non-smoking room and were given a room at the back of the hotel. It was quiet with virtually no traffic noise- just the occasional chiming of church bells at night. Accommodation was good. The room was clean and large enough without being a luxury room. The bathroom has modern facilities and a heated towel rack. No bath but we were happy the new glassed shower facilities (no dreaded shower curtains) Requests for an ironing board, extra pillow and tea/coffee making utensils were responded to quickly and pleasantly. A hot breakfast is provided until 10.30am. There is a selection of hot and cold food (though we wished they would vary the menu just a little - this probably doesn't matter if you are only staying a couple of days). The breakfast room was always well laid out and tables were efficiently and politely cleared. The only negatives were a slow check in and one unpleasant female staff member who couldn't manage a smile for weary travellers straight off a long flight. However, other staff members, particularly two of the three male desk staff, were pleasant and helpful. Extending our room and check out were handled well. Service staff were helpful and responsive. We selected this hotel based on previous comments on Trip Advisor and we thank those contributors who influenced our decision. We had a wonderful time exploring Rome and part of the enjoyment was coming 'home' each evening to a quiet comfortable modern temperatured-controlled room in a hotel where we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: luckystar36
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be well located and absolutely beautiful. Our room had been recently renovated and had a lovely flat screen TV, huge bathroom and amazing lighting. We found the staff at reception to be very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was superb, with a large range of hot and cold food. Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place but staff with bad attitude!”
Reviews.Author: MTLEurope
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, very well located near everything with many nice and affordable restaurants nearby. Do not only follow the recommendation of the hotel staff for the restaurants. Find your own, which will most likely be cheaper & better. A lot of inconsistancy with the free breakfast. If you go very early, at opening time, most of the display will not be ready, as you wait later, more stuff gets added. It is as if the cooking staff starts to work at the time the hotel opens up the breakfast area! We stayed for 4 nights and each morning were the same, so it is just not an accident. The desk staff in general is not very pleasant and do have an attitude problem. Specially, the late afternoon & evening staff. One day, we inquired for a place to do our own laundry to be told: "we do offer laundry". I replied that I prefered to do it myself in a laundromat. His response was: "Because it is cheaper". I will still recommend this place because of location and our room was just perfect. As for the attitude, I have found that in general, a lot of Romans are like this, unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “loved rome”
Reviews.Author: shuk2002
Reviews.Content: 15th October 2007, STEVIE & KERRY Belfast . Great time in rome enhanced by staying in this excellant hotel . Within walking distance to all major attractions .Stayed in a junior suite which on arrival had twin beds but on returning to reception we where quickly moved to another junior suite with a double bed with thanks to Luigi C . Would recommend to anyone { take full advantage of the good breakfast you'll need it !}

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous! Don’t go there, it’s not worth your money!”
Reviews.Author: KatyaL
Reviews.Content: We were given a very smelly smoking room when we asked for a non-smoking one. The room that we had was very tiny and not clean (the carpets were super dirty). The service is unbelievably bad, it took them 30 min to bring our luggage from the room to the reception area, and they could not order a taxi for us! The only two things I really enjoyed were the breakfast and the very spacious bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Irish-Rover79
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location,within walking distance to most sites and reasonable price for rooms.Modern rooms with flat-screen tv and internet access also.Hotel bar is small but fantastic value for money, e.g bottle of wine €7-8,bottles of beer €3 e.t.c, not a ripp off like other hotels i've stayed in. Would defo return to hotel and Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Business Travellers are a priority for Universo”
Reviews.Author: JR_ZA
Reviews.Content: Great experience apart from the check in and minibar. Got to the Hotel to check in, but was advised that room would only be ready at 14:00, which was no problem. Our bags were taken and stored for us. Got back at 14:00 to get checked in. The person helping us started with our check in, but interupted due to another (business) guest checking out. The check in person made us wait for an extremely lengthy check out of the other guest, who wanted his bill, a taxi to the airport and change of currency. Really inconvenient and disappointing experience to take second priority over a business traveller!! A card in the room stated that one can make use of the free minibar service. On check out I got charged 2 euro for an unknown item and for a cooldrink... Otherwise a pleasant experience. Beautiful room with LCD panel TV. Most of the staff speaks some English.

Reviews.Title: “o.k not great”
Reviews.Author: DallasSammy
Reviews.Content: Hotel close to train station and convenient to tour bus location.. Room was o.k.. NO DRAWS FOR CLOTHES ONLY A CLOSET. ROOMS WAS HARD TO COOL OFF. Breakfast area was crowded . Not convenient to area attractions. Have to take bus or walk a long distance. We did get a good rate at this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “The rude, but beautiful Universo”
Reviews.Author: Stormen
Reviews.Content: We - a couple in our mid 20's - just returned home from a stay at Hotel Universo in Rome. Our stay was for one week. To begin with, we were thoroughly impressed with Hotel Universo, and it's beautiful minimalistic interior design. Furthermore, the entire hotel has that special "New" glow, and with huge glass doors, marble floor, stainless steel decor and a neat cleanliness, it's hard not to take an immediate liking to the place. However, run across a few problems during your stay - and the elegant facade breaks apart... The second day of our stay, we had rented one of the movies available on the TV-system. At 10 Euro per movie, you expect things to run smoothly - so when the movie started skipping, pausing and shutting down, we called the Front desk. "Hi, sorry to bother you, but our TV-system is acting weird.. The movie won't play. Can you take a look at it?", I gently asked the receptionist over the phone. "No, sorry", he answered - and then hung up. Hardly what you can call good service. Furthermore, the entire staff - except for the cleaners perhaps - are arrogant and stuck-up (much like Romans in general) - and generally not keen to help you with anything beside handing you the key to your room. However, when you're working in the service sector, and in an exclusive hotel for foreigners, there's hardly room for being snotty. Hotel Universo was nice, but the staff nearly managed to ruin our stay. Good thing Rome is such a great city in general, that it compensated for snotty staff and rude service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Choice at all”
Reviews.Author: galileocan
Reviews.Content: I did not find this hotel to be positive in any way unfortunately. The favourable reviews on trip advisor for this property leave me wondering what hotel these people possibly could have stayed at because it certainly doesn't match the hotel I saw on my recent stay. The hotel is not located in the greatest area. Being near the Termini station may be considered central, but there are certainly countless better locations elsewhere in Rome. I booked this hotel on points, and I must admit I had some hesitation. Upon arrival, I immediately got a bad impression. The hotel lists itself as a four star hotel. This is ridiculous. The hotel is a tourist class 2 star hotel and nothing more. The lobby is tired and dreary, and the only thing more dreary are the inept, and very surly staff. The rooms aren't too bad if you don't care about lumpy beds. They have been re-done, but.........my room (like the others) had a shower stall with nothing more than a curtain. Naturally, the entire floor would be flooded with each shower. Quite gross when having to step around in it afterwords. I expect more for a hotel listing themself as a four star hotel. The breakfast was also quite unappealing - bacon literally swimming in a bucket of grease. Also be careful if the front desk tries to arrange a taxi for you (e.g. - to go to the airport). The costs are far higher than if you hailed one on your own. This truly is an unpleasant hotel, and since there are over 1100 other choices for hotels in the Eternal City, almost all of these (in my opinion) would be a better choice than the Universo. If you're OK with a basic hotel, then there won't be a problem. Do not expect anything remotely close to "4 stars".

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: w0rcestershire
Reviews.Content: Booked through asiarooms with some trepidation given the good/bad comments on tripadvisor but couldn't have been happier with the hotel. Arrived into Fiumicino airport and jumped on a direct train to Termini station in the heart of Rome. 40 mins later, we were at the hotel which is a 5 minute walk from Termini. There were comments on tripadvisor about the dodgy area around the hotel, but nothing of the sort - the area was fine, very much at the right end of Principe Amedeo, we felt safe and there are some great restaurants just around the corner (- Alessio in particular on the corner opposite hotel). Colloseum/Roman Forum is 10 min walk. Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain 15 min walk. Being 5 mins walk from Repubblica metro station was great after a couple of days of heavy walking. (A tip - when you're in the mood for walking, visit Pantheon/Piazza Navona/P.Venezia because there aren't metro stations by these sights). The hotel inside was great. Very modern room that looked as if it had been refurbed very recently. Size was fine if you're a reasonable person who doesn't expect a 13ft x13ft room in the centre of Rome. Staff were friendly (there were people moaning about them on this site but if you come across friendly yourself, you will be fine - if not, I have no sympathy). Only thing stopping a 5 out of 5 is the breakfast which was not great - the food tasted like it was cheap produce. Would definitely recommend it though and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and fine.”
Reviews.Author: iampickle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in July of 2007. Everything was fine - no problems. We had a triple - 3 small beds. Check-in was good. The room was small but very nice and clean. Air conditioning worked great. Bathroom was perfect and fairly large. Very modern and bright. No problems with room service. Breakfasts were good. Very close to train station and there are some OK restaurants on the street. All-in-all a very pleasant stay. Not really quaint or charming and the neighborhood isn't special. We took taxis to the main sites but probably could have walked. I thought the cost/benefit ratio was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, pity about the view”
Reviews.Author: Greg-n-Julie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Universo in Rome in Novermber 2006 and in general enjoyed it. There is no doubt that its location in the city largely makes taxis or the use of the metro redundant. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted, including the Spanish Steps, the Vatican and everywhere in between. Like other reviewers we used the Terravision shuttle from Ciampino and as it drops off at the Termini station there is no need to use a taxi unless you have mobility problems. We were able to walk to and from the bus drop off point, complete with luggage, in about 7-8 minutes. We found the hotel clean and spacious, although the bar was on the expensive side but then you would expect that in a hotel which is part of a chain. Breakfasts were basic but generally faultless throughout our stay, with a good range of food which should suit most tastes. The staff were generally cheerful and helpful, particularly at the reception. The only down side to our stay was the view from our room which was non-existent insofar as it was of aluminium roofs, pipes and the brickwork of an adjacent hotel. We got the hotel for a decent price so didn't feel hard done by but I suppose it's the luck of the draw. In general we were out walking so much the hotel was only to lay our heads down and get our breakfasts! We would go back to it if were getting roughly the same deal as we did before, mainly because the great location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “good location, miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: RocknRollStar
Reviews.Content: Had a triple room to accommodate 2 adults and 2 young kids, however this consisted of three single beds, two of which had been placed together and the third elsewhere in front of a bit of plastic which was the same size of the bed and was under the pillow and could be very uncomfortable. No tea/coffee making facilities, and no shower cubicle, just a curtain which meant that there was water everywhere in the bathroom. Manager was in a foul mood and extremely rude when we got there and thus suffered a tongue lashing at my expense, which did the trick for the next few days. The guy at reception spent all his time trying to book us a mini van at 60 euros an hour, and was more concerned with this than boking us in. Safe deposit box was at reception and with no separate room which meant that you had to deal with your box at reception, which was not ideal. Breakfast was bog standard and got boring after the very first day, did not eat in the hotel in the evenings. Location was fine, close enough to the Termini and close enough to some nice good Italian restaurants. Although there was a bar there was no ambiece at all, and for the four days that we stayed it was completely empty of people in the evenings. Although hotel was clean, im sure there are better hotels in Roma, although the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not again to Universo”
Reviews.Author: familytravelsguy
Reviews.Content: After searching online for reviews and prices for many hours, I found the Universo to offer the best accomadations and location in Rome for the price in comparison to other hotels. The positives included location, price, and cleanliness. Their location was quite close to the main travel hub in Rome (Termini), which allowed us to either walk, take the bus, metro, or trains to whatever sites we pleased. This came in very handy as we could pick whatever mode of transportation suited us best for the time of day or night. The prices that Universo offered at the time through most travel websites were about the same as those found at a 2 or 3 star hotel. Also, being a part of the Best Western hotel chain ensured a certain standard of cleanliness throughout the hotel. Our room was cleaned promptly and thoroughly each morning. However, the negatives sadly outweighed the positives. First and foremost coming to mind was the help (or lack thereof) from seemingly many of the reception staff members. It seemed that one was either 'greeted' by a grumpy desk woman (who seemed to be at the front desk both night and day...maybe that's why she was always so irritated with everyone?), or well-meaning gentlemen or ladies who unfortunately had large problems communicating in any language except Italian. (This was very disappointing, as it was a fair-sized hotel and most of the guests there seemed to be foreigners such as myself.) Whether getting short answers or answers to questions which were not asked...it seemed a chore trying to get any help from any staff members except for the Breakfast staff (whose English was excellent, and demeanor very cheerful...they should have been the ones working the front desk!). It also did not help that we were told to get ice from the bar downstairs, whose staff members openly rolled their eyes and made comments under their breath when asked politely for help. Also important was that the bed in our room was quite possibly thehardest bed we had ever slept on. This led to a few mornings with stiff backs. Overall, we really liked the location of Universo and the cleanliness of our room. However, the lack of help and/or friendliness of the desk staff, as well as a terrible mattress ultimately helped us to decide that we will definitely be staying at a different hotel during our next stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “forced Choice”
Reviews.Author: dommyboy
Reviews.Content: Having booked for three nights at the Presidents Hotel , we arrived to be told there was a problem with the room (flooding apparently) We were informed that a replacement at another Best Western had been found for us. A taxi was summoned and less than 10 minutes later we arrived at the Universo. We were not disappointed. The room was fine and all you'd want for a short city break. Despite earlier comments, I've had worse breakfasts. The over attentive waiters meant that we never had to wait for a table and there seemed to be plenty of what they had to offer.Location was excellent and there are enough restaurants and bars nearby to satisfy most tastes- avoid those near Termini though!The staff were fine and helped with sorting out the return taxi pre booked from the hotel we were meant to be staying at. The hotel is fine for what it is and as good as any I've stayed in at the price bracket it is aimed at.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: pacificapeace
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Sunday and were immediately given a room on the 7 floor. The room was clean and modern with a great big wardrobe, a 6ft bed (That's Queen size/Super King in Europe and King size in America), a plasma TV and a broadband Internet connection (wireless and wired connections). The Bathroom was large with cobalt blue granite floors and a large shower that had 2 shower heads one for showering and one for cooling yourself off on a hot day. The balcony was huge and spacious. We could see St Peters in the distance. We watched the fireworks at Castel Sant' Angelo from the balcony on the Saturday before we left. The staff at the desk were very helpful and spoke English. The waiters at the restaurant were pleasant (though the food was average). The man at the bar was very charming. The cleaning staff clean the rooms very early in the morning - from 6am onward. We usually got up very early to avoid the queues at the tourist spots. When we slept in, someone knocked at the door and tried to enter the room even though we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign hanging outside our door. When we left our room that morning we were greeted by two rather sleazy looking male cleaners (they were hovering around outside our room). They were very creepy. The other cleaner (a female) was quiet and very hard working and we were never disturbed by her. Everything at the Breakfast buffet was lovey except the bacon, egg and sausages . The rooms aren't sound proof as advertised. You have to ask for tea and coffee making facilities. The hotel staff do not replenish the tea/coffee or milk nor do they replace the used cups. Word of advise: Smile and be pleasant to the staff. If you do they will be pleasant in return.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised?”
Reviews.Author: poorbutliketotravel
Reviews.Content: Booked on Venere.com Apparently got upgraded. Paid 94 euro. Viewed some other rooms while open for cleaning and ours was huge by comparision (#241). Advertised as a 4 star hotel but same quality as an old Holiday Inn Express in the US. A bargain compared to the other hotels we stayed at in Rome - but don't pay anymore than 100 Euro. Very close to Termini train station. Check out was a pain because we booked with Venere and used a coupon code to save a whole 4%. Search google for coupon codes for Venere.com Breakfast was icky. Take the packaged pastries and bail!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about service”
Reviews.Author: austchris
Reviews.Content: First the positive - great location. 10min walk from Colosseum/Forum, 2 mins walk from train station where you arrive from and depart to the airport. Plenty of decent restaurants and cafes around area. Now the negatives. Arrived mid-afternoon, having paid in advance. Was given twin on 1st floor (sound of traffic on busy street). Returned to reception and asked for double on higher floor. Was given double on 1st floor corner room (two streets of traffic). Normally I wouldn't, but plucked up courage to ask one more time for higher floor. Got sighs and rolled eyes, and it took them 15 mins of messing around - no doubt in the hope I'd give up - before they gave me a new room, despite me being the only person at desk. Room three was much better, more modern, quiet inner part of building. Then on check-out they asked me to pay again, and only reluctantly agreed that I had paid already. As has already been noticed, morning breakfast staff were surly and packing up around diners, eager to get them out. But in my experience this is true of service staff all over Rome. Be rude back I reckon - they probably respect that. Location is terrific, room was good (eventually), but in future I'll look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JennieSurrey
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Stayed here with my sisters in May 2007. Location could not be faulted - so easy to get around to all of the attractions- although we did end up getting the underground a lot of the time - but at a Euro a go you'd be mad not to! The staff were excellent - very friendly. Showed us to our room and straightaway noticed that there were 2 beds and 3 of us. The rollaway was with us and set up within 15 minutes of arrival - now that's what I call service! Front desk staff were also very helpful making dinner reservations for us and calling taxis - especially as our Italian was awful to non existent. The room itself was fairly basic - but the bathroom was modern, and most importantly very clean. The only downside was the breakfast wasn't great - but enough to keep us going until lunch time - and left plenty of room for pizzas and ice creams. We booked via Gullivers Travel - and I can also recommend them too :o) On a separate note for Rome in May - be prepared to queue for everything! And if going on a Saturday go to the Cistene Chapel first as it closes at 1pm I think.

Reviews.Title: “JoandMel”
Reviews.Author: JoandMel
Reviews.Content: I was a little sceptic when we first arrived but once in our room and all was great. In the superior room everything was clean and fresh. The bathroom was great. Breakfast was great to get you started for the day. Nice and close to the main station and other public transport as well as close by walking distance. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Great value for money!!! Nothing better than a 'hairless' bathroom!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JoJoTeesside
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 day break in Rome. We stayed in the Best Western Universo hotel in Rome. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the main Termani. The hotel is immaculate, the rooms arn't huge but very new and very clean. Strangely the hotel bar was very cheap and the white haired barman was a lovely chap! The hotel is in a perfect location, a fantastic base for sight seeing. We used the city sightseeing bus which starts/ends at Maria Maggiore(a couple of minutes away from hotel), it cost 12 euros for two days and well worth it as you can just get on and off at all the major attractions as many times as you like. Rome is a beautiful city to explore and the italian people are very charming. We dined out at a restaurant situated around the corner from the Universo Hotel called Gran Cafe Strega, fabulous food/price and even has its own little waterfall outside (very romantic). We have been to Rome twice now and will be booking again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location at Universo”
Reviews.Author: IrelandEamonn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a first class location to avail of Romes many sights with easy access to all transport. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are large with all modern facilities and kept to a high standard. Breakfast is typically european and enough to get your day started.While the bar is small it makes up with its value prices. We stayed three nights and if in Rome again this hotel will be used again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: Fabhols
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, just returned. Well, mixed bag this hotel. You cant go wrong with this hotel in terms of location. You are literally 2 mins away from the central train and metro station so excellent for travelling ang getting to all the major sights. You can even walk to the sites in about 15-20 minutes. The room is modern and is nice and clean...I'm fussy with cleaniness..this hotel was fine no problem. However, it rates itself as a 4 star...but not to my standards i'm afraid. The room was comfortable, however: 1. You can hear the upstairs room toilet each time it flushes, which for the first time is shocking, however you get used to it. 2. Rooms aren't very sound proof - the 'crazy maid' that is mentioned in a previous review is still there. She starts doing her thing at about 6am! So you get disturbed whilst sleeping. The street outside is noisy with work going on. You have to sleep with the window shut. 3. You have to ask for tea and coffee making facilities which are complimentary. However, you may find that the maid clears away all the coffee/tea etc from your room leaving only your kettle. So you have to ask for more supplies of these. However, this can be a little annoying. Room service can take a while bringing these up so if your gasping for a cuppa - you'll have to gasp a little longer. I got told off by the waiter as there was already a kettle in the room and the bar sent up another one when I only asked for tea/coffee etc. I did tell them this in the first place. 4. We ordered a diet coke from room service which arrived fairly quickly with the metal bottle top still in tact. We were not given anything to open it with and room service didnt offer to open it before they left the room. So my husband had to open the bottle with his teeth!! 5. The hot breakfast buffet is limited to tiny sausages, very salty bacon and scrambled egg everyday. The rest of breakfast is basic by standard. Judging by breakfast we didnt eat at the resturant in the evening. Room service menu is very limited. These things did spoil our expectations of the hotel but none the less it is a good base if these issues dont bother you. we just got used to it after a couple of days. Location definately compensates. The front desk are helpful and the service they provide is good. They are good at suggesting where to eat and will make a reservation for you promptly without you having to ask. There isn't a safe in the room so you have to use one at reception. It is trustworthy and they do take precautions which was reassuring. They seal your currency in an envelope and make you sign across the seal. We gave them our passports and currenct it was fine on collection. On the subject of passports - they retained ours upon check-in saying they'd return them in 20 mis - dont forget that they have your passport as they will forget to return it in 20 mins so you have to chase. Places to eat: There is a cheap pizzaeria on the same road at the hotel 'Smelda' or something like that (sorry cant remember) but its cheap and cheerful. In the next street there is a better one called Tudini's where food and service are both good. If you go down out the hotel and turn left then left again there is a resturant called 'matriciana' which is a traditional italian with good food. If you turn right there is a resturant build in a tower which the hotel also recommend - however this isn't all that. The best resturants we ate at were : 'bi-bi-qu' modern contemporay resturant with delicious food and ambience. its about 20 min in taxi. But the best traditional italiant we went to was 'Sabatini' in Trastervere - superb food and its prim and proper. well wortht the visit - we'll definately go there again. If you plan to use the metro - its really easy - buy a three days metro ticket unlimited use - for about 11 euros its worth it. You buy these from the newsagents in the termini station. All in all - ok hotel but I wasn't impressed with the service - shame - but you should always go and try it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: Location by Rome Termini is great as the hotel is close to the main train station. As for the hotel itself, we found our room and stay to be average at best. We got a nice "loft" room, with the beds on the upper part of the loft via stairs, with the bathroom and closets on the lower part of the loft. In all 3 nights, the room stayed very warm and we had to leave the door to the balcony window opened all night just to cool the entire room down! Because of this, we heard all the street noise and loud street people. The bathroom was nice and large but discovered some backup in the shower, probably due to the old pipes / plumbing of the building. Breakfast was not much to write about .... it's there, but don't expect it to be memorable. Due to the large numbers of visitors, the breakfast items felt mass produced: orange juice and coffee via a machine, huge pans of eggs, unhealthy bacon and mini sausage links that looked uninviting. Housekeeping was rushed and we didn't appreciate being buzzed by phone and then being hung up after picking up. I'm a fan of Best Westerns in Europe as I have stayed in properties in Paris, Turin, and Florence, but if given an opportunity to stay in Rome again, I'd seek a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjChester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 15th-19th January, could not fault it at all. Rooms were very spacious and clean, bar was very reasonable and the hot breakfast was more than adequate. WARNING...the cafe bar at the corner of the street (Washington Snack Bar) this place is a total rip off, they charged us 41 euros for two beers a gin & tonic and a Vodka & coke, you are best to avoid this place at all costs, the waiter was reluctant to even give us the change from the 50 euros we handed over to him...BE WARNED !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: keb147
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location a few blocks from the Termani - the main station which takes you to all the main attractions in Rome. The rooms are very modern and well equiped. English speaking staff, who are friendley and helpful. Morning buffet is adequate - selection of drinks and snacks. I stayed here for 2 nights and would definately go back again! You could certainly do a lot worse for a hotel in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great price too!”
Reviews.Author: dgutte
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at this hotel. We chose the Termini area as we did not want to trawl around town, or get a taxi looking for a hotel some distance from the station after arriving on the Terravision Bus. We found the hotel friendly and it had a small hotel feel, although it had lots of rooms. I guess that it wasn't busy as we didn't really see many people whilst we were there. We booked a superior room - I am not sure what the difference between a standard and superior room is. However we had lots of room and a massive bathroom with a seperate area for the bidet and toilet. The room was extremely modern, all glass and dark wood. We had internet access (which we didn't use) lots of choice on the inhouse movies and a flat screen TV with Sky News, BBC News and CNN, as well as some Italian stations. The room was quiet apart from the car horns on the street (fact of life in a big city). We were on the 4th floor with a lovely stone balcony, which I imagine would be great in the summer. On our 2nd night we ate dinner in the restaurant which was very good; excellent service and quite reasonable for what we ate and drank! There were some downsides - there was no in room safe, you had to request that the mini bar be stocked (probably a good thing that it wasn't!) and the breakfast was mainly a cold buffet, only a small amount of scrambled egg and small sausage. But if you enjoy your cereals and pastries you will be in heaven. Will we return here on our next visit? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike8
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a 3 day stay. Ironically enough we also stayed in room 341 which has the photo of damp in the bathroom posted by another visitor. Very pleased to say no evidence of damp, the room was lovely and finished to a high standard with a shower to die for. Very comfortable and modern / plasma TV and plenty of room. This particular room had a double leather settee (sofa bed) which I presume they use as a family room, but for 2 it was great . Reception Staff were friendly and helpful, and hotel generally kept clean to a high standard. Bar prices comparibly cheap compared with local bars, however the barman needs to be able to smile a bit more ! Breakfast was good and the hot food was also very pleasant before a day of long walks. Would definately recommend to others particularly its short distance from the central termini station (less than 5 minute walk). Tip - get the Cotral bus from the airport (Ciampino ) only 5 euros each way...bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located, best bathroom in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Italiacalcio
Reviews.Content: My husband an I own the only official Italian soccer school in the United Staes. Part of our business involves bringing youth soccer players and their families to Italy each summer to play in a tournament. We often stay in Rome with our family as well as my husband is an Italian citizen. July 2006 marked our 4th stay at the Hotel Universo with our group - we were there for 4 days. We use this hotel becasue it is reasonably priced, centrally located and within walking distance to many good restaurants. The hotel had been renovated since our last stay in 2004 and I was really surprised and pleased by the changes. While our triple room was small, with little space to place our clothes, it was fresh and modern, with a nice long desk for me to use my laptop. The room had large plasma type television and fantastic high speed internet connection. The best feature was the ENORMOUS bathroom with gorgeous cobalt blue granite floors, double sink, separate bath and beautifully tiled shower. The shower even had 2 shower heads and was really powerful. Bathroom came equipped with a towel warmer, full length mirror, great toiletries, and was SUPER clean. The breakfast in the large breakfast room offered a huge assortment, as in past years, although I hate those caffe machines. The bar area had also been renovated and although the bartender was a bit sour, the bar was kept well stocked and not overly pricey. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night with our daughters because we were waiting to watch Italy play Germany in the World Cup semifinal in a meeting room that the hotel had kindly set up. The food was okay but the selection was very limited which could have been because the staff wanted to close early to watch the World Cup - for which I could hardly blame them! The only problem we had was the crazy maid service that made it impossible to sleep after 7:00am! I travel several times a year to Italy and elsewhere in Europe as well as the United States and have never, ever experienced being awakened at 6:45 or 7:00am EVERY DAY by maids clearning rooms, including loudly dragging service carts down the halls, making noise opening and closing doors, and vacuuming empty rooms! Maybe guests on other floors did not have this experience but it was no picnic never getting adequate sleep. I thought it was all too ironic that the hotel thoughfully provides a choice of pillows, rare for most hotels, but doesn't allow you to get a good night's rest! I suppose if we went to bed at 10:00pm, getting up at 6:45 would not be a problem, but after all this is Roma, and we are often out until 12:30 or 1:00am. No guests should be awakekend this early - unless you request a wake up call! We are bringing our group to the Universo again in 2007, although I will make sure they put me on a floor that is the last floor cleaned for the day!

Reviews.Title: “needs improvemnet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i read the reviews before staying here, and decided to take a try.Big mistake--now i'm not disgruntled or picky but i'm giving my view.i pre payed for 4 nights but checked in a day late to find my room was given away, although nice the room i was given was not the one paid for. I paid for room with air cond.Hotel manager told me no rooms had a/c, except from 2-7 p.m. We are from Miami and used to hot weather, but 3 very miserable sleepless nights later i was happy to leave. Breakfast is the best thing at this hotel. This place almost ruined my vacation, 1st trip to Italy, but you make your decision.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome.”
Reviews.Author: highlandtoffee
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff really helpful and pleasant. Good location for Termini and metro. Hotel room massive and bathroom/shower lovely. Breakfast very continental and plentiful.
